She has been in this business for nine years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the clothing. She is applying for the loan to buy blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets.

loans.name: Marcely

texts.es: Marcely es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad. Su mayor motivación es su hijo de 18 meses. Sueña con poderle ofrecer un buen mañana y que pueda tener acceso a una vida económica y social digna.  Estas razones la han motivado a dedicarse a la venta de productos Herbalife desde su casa, ya que le proporciona el tiempo para dedicarle a su hijo y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Marcely no cuenta con los recursos para montar su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido. Espera poder salir adelante con su hijo y tener una fuente de ingresos estable para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marcely, who is 22 years old, is a young entrepreneur whose primary motivation is her 18-month-old son.  She dreams of being able to offer him a bright future and of having a decent economic and social life.  She began to sell Herbalife products from her home, as that allows her to spend time with her son and also to generate an income with which to support her family.  Marcela does not have the resources to build her business and so she is applying for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of supplies.  She hopes to be able to get by with her son and to have a steady source of income which will enable her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty, health and household goods

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es: Alba Rosa de 56 años de edad se ha dedicado a la confección desde que se separó de su esposo, Debido a esta situación  se vio en la necesidad de tener que emplearse para buscar el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos. Laboró por muchos años en diferentes talleres de confección. Posteriormente decidió independizarse, compró una máquina de coser en la cual comenzó realizando arreglos de modistería a sus vecinos. Hoy elabora todo tipo de prendas, en especial uniformes para instituciones educativas. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para las compra de tela que empleará en la elaboración de uniformes para la temporada de inicio de clases. Su mayor deseo es poder adquirir casa  propia, ya que la mayoría de sus ingresos los destina para el arriendo, teniendo que pasar en muchas ocasiones por carencia de alimentos.
texts.en: Alba Rosa, fifty-six, has earned her living as a seamstress since separating from her husband.  Due to her situation, she found herself in need of employment to support their two children.   She worked for many years in various sewing workshops, and then decided to go out on her own.  She bought a sewing machine and started mending dresses for the neighbors.  Now she makes all kinds of items, particularly school uniforms.  She is seeking a loan to buy fabric to make uniforms for the start of the school year.  Her greatest dream is to be able to buy her own house because most of her income goes to rent such that oftentimes there is a lack of food.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making uniforms.

loans.name: Victoria Eugenia

texts.es: Victoria de 44 años de edad, es una mujer que ha laborado toda su vida en oficios varios, debido a las largas horas de trabajo se enfermó de la columna y tuvo que dejar de laborar. A raíz de esta situación sus ingresos se estancaron. Agobiada por su dura situación económica decidió alquilar una casa grande que convirtió en una residencia para hospedar a conductores, transportadores y camioneros, con el fin de generar ingresos para sostenerse económicamente. Su mayor sueño es poder adecuar su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de tres camas, tres televisores y lencería. Espera que con su proyecto de negocio su calidad de vida mejore y que se acaben sus problemas económicos.
texts.en: Victoria, who is 44, is a woman who has worked in a number of jobs during her life.  Due to the long working hours, she developed back problems and had to give up work.  As a result, her income dried up.  Overwhelmed by economic hardship, she decided to rent a large house which she converted into a hostel for motorists, delivery drivers and truckers, as a means of generating income with which to support herself financially.  Her greatest dream is to be able to adapt her business and so she is applying for a loan to buy three beds, three television sets and bed linen.  She hopes that her business project will improve her quality of life and end her financial problems.

loans.use: to buy three beds, three TV sets and bed linen

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es: Diana Yaneth de 41 años, es una mujer que se esmera por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos menores de edad, su mayor sueño es poderles ofrecer una buena educación porque considera que es el mayor tesoro que puede entregarles. Es ama de casa pero debido a la situación económica utilizó sus ahorros para montar un restaurante y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos, mecatos y refrescos, con el propósito de mejorar su oferta de menús. Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar su empresa para generar mayores ingresos y ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Diana Yaneth is a 41-year-old woman who works hard to provide a better life for her three children.  Her dream is to be able to offer them a good education, since she considers this to be the greatest treasure she can give them.  She is a homemaker, but given her economic situation, she used her savings to start a restaurant and make income to support her household and improve her family's quality of life.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy ingredients for the preparation of food, pastries and beverages, so that she can improve the offerings on her menus.  She dreams of being able to expand her business and generate more income so that she can offer her children the opportunity to attend college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of food, pastries and beverages.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco años de edad. Ella se ha dedicado desde muy pequeña a la crianza de bovinos y ha ayudar a su padre en la agricultura. A los 16 años de edad se caso y empezó a trabajar junto con él. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lograron comprar un par de vacas lecheras. Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a seis kilómetros de su vivienda, luego transporta los insumos en un vehiculo y su esposo los traslada en una carreta durante tres kilómetros hasta el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, que le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y en un futuro desea comprar más vacas para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 53 years old and is married.  From a very young age she became involved in raising cattle and helped her father with his farm work.  At the age of 16 she got married and began to work alongside her husband.  With a great deal of effort and work, they managed to buy a pair of dairy cows. She buys her agricultural supplies in a city that is six kilometers from her home.  She then transports the supplies in a vehicle and her husband brings them in a cart another three kilometers where they have their crops.

She is seeking this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy two dairy cows, which will help her to increase her income.  In the future she wants to buy two more cows so that she can improve conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sandra Damaris

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad es una mujer que desde su adolescencia se apasionó por los negocios, cuenta que cuando estudiaba en el colegio era la vendedora de dulces de la clase. Siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio pero no contaba con los recursos para su proyecto, por lo cual al terminar sus estudios de bachillerato se empleó en el sector de confección, allí laboró por varios años y luego renunció cansada de la explotación que recibía por parte de sus superiores. Con la liquidación comenzó vendiendo ropa a sus familiares y vecinos y luego con la rentabilidad del negocio decidió colocar un local. En la actualidad ofrece servicio de papelería, helados y venta de ropa. Su mayor deseo es acreditar su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará artículos escolares para la temporada de principio de año.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old, and since her adolescent years she has had a passion for business.  She reports that when she was in grade school she was the one who sold sweets for her class.  She always dreamed of having her own business, but never had the resources to realize her goals.  When she finished her bachelor's degree, she worked for a candy company.  She labored there for several years, and eventually left when she became tired of being exploited by her superiors.

She then began selling clothes to neighbors and relatives, and given the profitability of the business, she decided to open a shop.  Currently she sells items such as stationary, clothes and ice cream.  Her main goal is to expand her business.  Thus, she is seeking a loan to buy school supplies to sell at the beginning of the year.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señorita Hilda, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia continua dedicandose a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados , la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz y aceite.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in the city of Cusco in Peru.

She is continuing in her business selling food in one of the local markets.  She enjoys this activity, and business is good thanks to the efforts she makes every day.  She is a hardworking and dedicated person and is able to provide a better life for her family because of these traits.

Hilda is seeking this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business such as rice and oil.  She is grateful for this loan opportunity and promises to repay her loan according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes, toys, accessories)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Hilda Luciana

texts.es:
La socia Luciana pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 

La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de comida en uno de los mercados,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz,aceite y menestras.
Luciana está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Luciana is a member of the group “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” (Lord of Chimpahuaylla Miracles) in the city of Cusco, Perú. 

The member continues to devote herself to the business of selling food in one of the markets. The member has a good time in her business, which is doing well thanks to the commitment she puts in each day. The member wants to be able to continue working to be able to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her business like rice, oil and beans.

Luciana is very happy and grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give a better quality of life to her family and to help maintain and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business like rice, oil and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia Valentina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 

La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,gaseosas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.

Valentina está agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Valentina’s a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues in the grocery selling business.  She sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk and soft-drinks, among others.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to continue working to support her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy soft-drinks for her business.  Valentina is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide better quality of life for her family and helping her to keep and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es: Doña Ruth mujer trabajadora sale adelante al lado de su esposo quien es comerciante con sus ingresos ha estado apoyando al máximo a sus hijos para que ellos puedan obtener lo primordial en la vida alimentación y educación, doña Belina con mucha dedicación mantiene su negocio de comidería y alquiler de cuartos otro ingreso mas que le ha ayudado a pagar sus créditos que ha utilizado para mejoras de sus cuartos aunque en la actualidad le falta levantar su casa de concreto ya que esta forrada de madera y zinc, pero ella irá haciendo todos esos pendientes poco a poco ya que no cuenta con suficientes recursos. Ahora su prioridad es mejorar algunos cuartos de alquiler, para brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes, con el préstamo comprara arena, cemento, hierro, bloques, piedrín, zinc y perlines, así ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth’s a hardworking woman who gets ahead alongside her husband who is a merchant.  She’s been using her income to support her children to the maximum degree so that they can obtain what’s basic for life: food and education.  

Belina’s very dedicated to her food and room rental business, additional income that’s helped her repay the loans she’s used to improve the rooms although she still needs to build her house out of concrete since it’s currently wood and metal sheeting.  But she’ll be doing these projects piecemeal because she does not have sufficient resources.  

Her priority now is to improve some of the rental rooms to provide better conditions for her customers.  She will use the loan to buy sand, cement, rebar, concrete blocks, gravel, metal sheeting and roof purlins thus gradually improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,huevos,aceite entre otros,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas y arroz.
La socia Marleni está agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Marleni's a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues in the grocery selling business.  She sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks, eggs and oil, among others.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to continue working to support her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy merchandise like soft-drinks and rice.  Marleni is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide better quality of life for her family and helping her to keep and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft-drinks and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mobile phone airtime recharge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Zoraida, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz y azucar para su negocio.

La socia Zoraida está agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad, llevar el sustento a su casa y proporcionarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in the city of Cusco, Peru.  

She continues to make a living in her grocery store business.  She sells basic foodstuffs like rice, sugar, and milk, among others.  She has a good time in her business and everything is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day.  She wishes to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.    

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like rice and sugar for her business.

Zoraida is grateful to KIVA for allowing her to maintain her business, support her home, and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El socio Elvis pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.

El socio continua dedicandose a la ganaderia ,el socio lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos como forraje y un torete. 
Elvis agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad y seguir creciendo cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla Community Bank in Cusco, Peru. 

He continues his work raising cattle, a job he’s had for many years. All is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. Elvis is a responsible person and is helping his family get ahead.

He is seeking a loan to buy cattle fodder and a young bull. He is grateful to Kiva donors as the loan allows him grow his business.

loans.use: buy cattle fodder and a young bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene  61 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo que dependen de ella y está Soltera, su actividad es el comercio, tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 5 años, cuenta con una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en la entrada de su aldea, y también por su buen trato y variedad de productos.
Doña Santos esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, leches, quesos, frijoles, café, pan, churros, refrescos, aguas, carnes de pollo y cosméticos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y así  tener más surtido  su negocio, ya que se aproxima la temporada navideña lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Santos su sueño es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y mejorar un poco la calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Haydee se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos y perfumería cuenta con más de 7 años de experiencia en el negocio.
Doña Maritza se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, desde hace mas de 1 año.
Doña Maria Rodríguez se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales desde hace más de 8 años.
 
Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Ms. Santos is 61 years old.  She is single and has 1 child who depends on her.  She is in sales and has had a grocery store for more than 5 years.  She has a good customer base, since her business is located at the entrance to her village, and also because of her good treatment and variety of products.

Ms. Santos is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, butter, sausages, milk, cheese, beans, coffee, bread, churros, sodas, water, chicken, and cosmetics to satisfy her clients’ demands and have more merchandise in her store. Since the Christmas season is getting close, this will allow her to increase her income and cover her family’s expenses and her financial obligations.

Ms. Santos’ dream is to have a larger store where she can better care for her clients and improve her family’s quality of life.

Ms. Haydee has more than 7 years of experience selling cosmetics and perfumes.

Ms. Maritza has sold basic grains for more than 1 year.

Ms. Maria Rodríguez has been making and selling bread and tamales for more than 8 years.

Danlí, Honduras – November 2012

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, butter, sausages, milk, cheese, beans, coffee, bread, churros, sodas, water, chicken and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es: El señor Wilberto, habitante de municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, su mayor sueño es darle mejores condiciones a sus hijos y darles un hogar digno y seguro, su  mayor dificultad es que no puede recaudar todo el dinero para  comprar los materiales a utilizar. con este nuevo Financiamiento comprara los siguientes Materiales: Perlines, Cemento, Hierro, Estrivos, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado a travez de Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr Wilberto lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His greatest dream is to improve his children’s living conditions and give them a decent, safe home.  His greatest difficulty is that he cannot raise all the money to buy materials to use.  With this new loan he will buy the following materials: purlins, cement, iron, supports, etc.

He is grateful for the help Afodenic has given him through Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Unidos Group

texts.es:
La señora Fanny tiene  32 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, está Casada y convive con su esposo, su actividad es el comercio, cuenta con una pulpería desde hace mas de 3 años. 
Doña Fanny cuenta con una buena clientela porque su negocio está ubicado en una de las aldeas de mayor producción de café de la zona, y vende de todo un poco de la canasta básica familiar, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, leches, quesos, carnes de pollo, res, frijoles, salsas, pastas, refrescos, etc. y poder así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Fanny con el apoyo del préstamo, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, porque se aproxima la temporada alta en ventas, y la cosecha de café y granos básicos, lo que espera le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Fanny su sueño es darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia y el estudio a sus hijos.  
La señora Mileidy se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos y perfumería cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia.
La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de gasolina, desde hace más de 2 años.
La Señora María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales desde hace mas de 8 años.
Don Héctor, se dedica al comercio tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 6 años.     
 
Danlí, Honduras –Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Ms. Fanny is 32 years old and has 2 children who depend on her.  She is married and lives with her husband.  She is in sales and has had a grocery store for more than 3 years.

Ms. Fanny has a good client base because her business is located in one of the villages with the largest coffee production in the area, and she sells a little bit of everything for basic family needs. She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, butter, sausage, milk, cheese, chicken, beef, beans, salsa, pasta, drinks, etc. to be able to meet her clients’ demands.
 
With the help of this loan, Ms. Fanny will buy a better assortment of merchandise for her business because the peak season for sales is coming, as well as the harvest of coffee and basic grains.  She hopes this will increase her income to cover her family’s expenses and financial obligations.

Ms. Fanny’s dream is to give her family a better quality of life and schooling for her children.

Ms. Mileidy has more than 2 years of experience selling cosmetics and perfume.

Ms. Juana has been selling gasoline for more than 2 years.

Ms. María has been making and selling bread and nacatamales, a typical dish made with corn and pork, for more than 8 years.

Mr. Héctor has owned a grocery store for more than 6 years.

Danlí, Honduras – November 2012

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, butter, sausage, milk, cheese, chicken, beef, beans, salsa, pasta, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 51 años, es un hombre lleno de fortalezas y motivaciones para sacar adelante a su esposa y a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Desde joven se rebuscó la vida realizando trabajos de calle ya que no contó con la fortuna de estudiar. Con los ahorros que logró acumular, montó su propio negocio en donde comercializa dulces, helados y ofrece el servicio de videojuegos. Labora todos los días de 9 de la mañana a 9 de la noche. En estos momentos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo, con el fin de aprovechar las vacaciones de fin de año e incrementar sus ingresos. Su mayor reto es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la escuela.
texts.en: Hector is 51 years old and is full of strength and motivations to get ahead with his wife and three children.  Since he was young, he has been doing odd jobs and was not able to attend school.  With the money he was able to save up, he was able to start his own business selling candy, frozen treats, and video game services.  He works every day from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm.  He is asking for a loan so that he can take advantage of the year end vacation and increase his income.  His main challenge is to provide his family with a better quality of life and offer his children the opportunity to attend school.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Jonathan Alexis

texts.es: Jonathan es un joven emprendedor y con muchos deseos de progresar, tiene claro que la única forma de lograrlo es trabajando duro. Su familia es lo más importante en su vida, y por ellos es que desea convertirse en un microempresario de éxito para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y que no tengan que pasar ningún tipo de necesidades. Se dedica a la porcicultura desde hace tres años, en la actualidad cuenta con 9 lechones pero desea incrementar su capacidad de producción debido a que tiene buena demanda en su localidad. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuido de engorde y poder venderlos más rápido aprovechando la temporada de fin de año, también espera poder construir un segundo corral para albergar mayor número de cerdos. Su mayor deseo es ver a su familia feliz y poder consolidar su negocio.
texts.en: Jonathan is an enterprising man with many desires to progress.  He is certain that the only way to do so is through hard work.  His family is the most important thing in his life and he wants to become a successful small businessman so that he can offer his children a better quality of life so that they don’t have to want for anything.  He raises pigs and has been doing so for three years.  He has nine pigs but he wants to increase his production because he has good local demand.  He is asking for this loan to buy pigs and fatten them up quickly so that he can take advantage of the end of the year.  He also wants to build a second corral in order to shelter a large number of pigs.  His greatest desire is to see his family happy and be able to consolidate his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores de 52 años de edad es una mujer luchadora a la que le ha tocado trabajar y cuidar de sus tres hijos al tiempo, inducida por las carencias económicas que ha vivido, tomó la determinación de dedicarse a oficios varios en casas de familia, para poder suministrarle a sus hijos alimento y educación. Con los ahorros que logró acumular durante sus empleos decidió colocar una pequeña vitrina en la sala de su casa para vender artículos de promoción. Su deseo es poder montar una miscelánea, pero es conciente que requiere de tiempo y de disciplina para montar el negocio que sueña. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y tener más variedad de productos. Con esto ella podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerle educación superior a su hijo menor.
texts.en: Maria Dolores is 52 years old and is a hardworking woman who has had to work and care for her three children.  Induced by the financial challenges she has lived through, she was determined to do various things in family homes, in order to feed and educate her children.  With the money she saved up from her jobs she decided to place a small display case in her living room to sell promotional items.  She wants to be able to set up a general store, but she knows that it takes time and discipline to set up a business.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy an assortment of goods to increase her sales and have a variety of products on hand.  With this she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and a higher education to her son.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 1 hijos que dependen de ella, está Casada y vive con su esposo, su actividad es el comercio cuenta con una pulpería desde hace mas de 3 años, cuenta con una buena clientela ya que en su negocio vende de todo un poco de la canasta básica familiar y se encuentra ubicado en un lugar estratégico de alto transito de personas que van hacia otra  aldeas vecinas.
Doña Ana ésta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, leches, quesos, frijoles, sopas, salsas, pastas, condimentos, carnes de pollo y res. Y poder satisfacer la demanda.
Doña Ana espera que sus ventas aumenten en esta temporada lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Ana su sueño es darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan terminar sus estudios.  
Doña Silvia se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales y pan cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia.
Doña Santos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales desde hace más de 4 años.
Doña Diana se dedica al cultivo y venta de granos básicos desde hace más de 1 año.   
 

Danlí, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and has a son who depends on her.  She is married and lives with her husband.  She has had a grocery store for three years and has good customers.  She sells all sorts of basic food items in her store and it’s located in a strategic, high trafficked area.

Ana is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, lard, sausages, milk, cheeses, beans, soups, sauces, pasta, condiments, poultry and beef so that she can satisfy her customer demand.

Ana is hoping that her sales increase during this season so that she can increase her income and cover her family expenses.

Ana’s dream is to provide her family with a better quality of life so that her children can complete their education.

Silvia makes nacatamales and bread and has done so for three years.
Santos also makes bread and nacatamales and has done so for more than four years.
Diana raises and sells basic grains and has done so for a year.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier es un hombre al que le ha tocado luchar fuertemente en la vida para alcanzar sus objetivos. Su mayor sueño era montar su negocio de estampación, ya que toda su vida laboró dentro de este gremio lo cual le permitió adquirir el conocimiento y la experiencia para independizarse. Su vida no ha sido color de rosas, pues las grandes dificultades económicas por las que ha tenido que padecer, le han dejado grandes secuelas. Su negocio presentó periodos de crisis demasiado fuertes que lo condujeron a la quiebra. Lleno de  fuerza y entusiasmo decidió volver a empezar, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará una máquina que le permitirá ahorrar en costos y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Javier has had to struggle hard in life in order to reach his objectives.  His main dream is to start a stamping business, since he worked in this field all his life.  This allowed him to gain the experience he needed to become independent.  His life has not been a bed of roses.  The financial difficulties he has had to face have left him great after effects.  His business had periods of very difficult crisis that left him in bankruptcy, but he was full of strength and enthusiasm and decided to start again, so he is asking for a loan to buy a machine that will allow him to save on costs and increase his income to improve his family’s living conditions

loans.use: to buy a stamping machine.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es: Doña Lili tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda sus tres hijos  ya casados siempre le ayudan económicamente, ella vende ropa nueva antes ofrecía sus productos en el mercado pero decidió instalarse en su casa para así descansar mas ya que a su edad es más cansado, sus créditos los utiliza en invertir en su negocio en esta ocasión hará lo mismo comprar ropa nueva variada, con esta inversion espera aumentar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Lili is 57 years old, widowed, and has three adult children, already married, but who help her financially.  She sells new clothing and used to sell her products in the market, but she decided to set up in her home so that she could rest more because of her age.  She will use the money from this loan to buy various new clothing and she hopes to gain more customers with this investment and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es: Juan Orlando es un fiel enamorado de la vida. A sus 60 años de edad, lo que le sobran son deseos de sentirse vivo y útil, por eso dice que “mientras tenga salud que el trabajo no falte”. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su puesto de frutas ubicado cerca del Parque principal del municipio de Amagá, Colombia. Aunque su vida es bastante compleja debido a que aparte de laborar para el sostenimiento de su casa, cuida de su esposa que padece de trastornos psicológicos debe costear sus medicamentos. Razón por la cual sus gastos se han incrementado y la legumbrería no alcanza a cubrir sus egresos. Motivado por las dificultades económicas se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne de cerdo y frutas, surtido que le permitirá ampliar su oferta y generarle mayores rendimientos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Juan Orlando loves life.  He is 60 years old and he feels alive and useful.  He says, “As long as I have my health, I will never be short of work.”  Every day he gets up very early to go to his fruit stall, located near the main city park in Amaga, Colombia.  Even though his life is very complicated, because aside from working to support his household, he cares for his wife who suffers from psychological disorders and must take her medications.  For this reason his expenses have gone up and his fruit business has not produced enough income to cover his expenses.  Motivated by these economic difficulties, he finds himself asking for a loan so he can buy pork and fruit that will allow him to offer more products and generate better income that will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork and fruit.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La señora Reina  tiene  65 años de edad, no tiene dependientes y está Casada, su actividad es el comercio y se  dedica a la venta de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles y venta de pan de repostería.
Doña Reina cuenta con más de 23 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos cuenta una buena clientela ya que su negocio lo realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante en las diferentes aldeas vecinas, ésta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca embutidos, lácteos, carnes de pollo, res y pan. Y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Reina del préstamo que reciba tendrá más surtido  y con esto espera que sus ventas aumenten para poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Reina  su sueño es hacer más grande su negocio.
Doña Nohemí se dedica  a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace 4 años.   


Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Reina is 65 years old, married, and has no dependents.  She sells basic grains such as corn and beans, and also pastries.  Reina has more than 23 years’ experience and she has steady customers.  She works out of her home and on foot in different adjacent neighborhoods.  She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, lard, sausages, milk products, chicken, beef, and bread.  In this way she can satisfy her customer demands.  This loan will allow her to have a greater assortment and increase her sales so that she can improve her quality of life. 

Reina’s dream is to grow her business.
Nohemí sells food and snacks and has done so for four years.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: la Señora Tereza, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, desde muy joven a luchado para sacar adelante a sus hijos y de mejorar de vida, ella es comercia y gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio a credido mucho, ya que sus clientes demandan varios productos los cuales ella a invertido en ellos, con este nuevo financiamiento podra ampliar su inventario en los productos que vende y asi tener mejores ingresos. doña Tereza se encuentra muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Tereza lives in Ticuantepe and has had to work hard to get her children ahead and improve her life.  She is a merchant and thanks to her efforts, her business has grown very much.  Her customers have demanded various products in which she has invested and increased her income.  Tereza is very grateful for the support from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Getrudis

texts.es: La señora Getrudis tiene 60 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son dependientes de ella ya que aún están en edad escolar, vive en la provincia sacaba de Cochabamba en la zona sud, perseverante con sus metas, sus hijos están estudiando y son alumnos muy buenos, todo eso lo hizo gracias a la tiendita que ella misma logro establecer, su esposo falleció hace ya 15 años, la señora Getrudis es una persona luchadora y con ganas de sacar a sus hijos adelante, además también se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos los cuales los vende en la zona en la que vive,. Ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería para su tiendita y poder construir un corral para sus cerdos y para sus pollos.
texts.en:
Getrudis is 60 years old and has two school-aged children who depend on her.  She lives in the southern zone of the Cochabamba province.  Her children attend school and are very good students.  She was able to do all of this, thanks to the little store that she was able to set up.  Her husband passed away 15 years ago.

Getrudis is a hardworking person with a desire to get her children ahead.  She also raises pigs and chickens, which she sells in the same zone where she lives.  She needs this loan so that she can build a pen for her pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Eva Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Eva es una tiene su negocio en un mercado de Danli, al este de Honduras por una terminal de de buses, donde la afluencia de personas es muy abundante su negocio consiste en la venta de sandalias de baño para hombre, mujer y niños, tambien vende ropa interior, pero su fuerte es la venta de sandalias.
Doña Eva tiene 6 años de dedicarse a su actividad, la ubicación estratégica de su negocio le permite atraer gran cantidad de clientes especialmente las personas que vienen del interior de la ciudad, es una persona humilde, trabajadora, amable y muy atenta con sus clientes lo que le ha permitido aumentar sus ventas.
Doña Eva está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blúmeres, calcetines, calzoncillos, sandalias y zapatos  para surtir su negocio en esta época navideña que sus ventas aumentan bastante.
Doña Eva cuenta con el apoyo de su familia lo que la fortalece cada día y su sueño es trabajando para salir adelante con su familia. 


 
Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Eva has a business in a Danhi market in Eastern Honduras, near a bus terminal, where there is much affluence.  Her business involves selling bath slippers for men, women, and children.  She also sells undergarments, but her main source of income are the slippers.

Eva has been running her business for six years and its strategic location allows her to attract a large number of customers, especially those who come from the center of the city.  She is a humble, hardworking, friendly woman, very helpful to her customers.  This has allowed her to increase her sales.

Doña Eva está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blúmeres, calcetines, calzoncillos, sandalias y zapatos para surtir su negocio en esta época navideña que sus ventas aumentan bastante.
Doña Eva cuenta con el apoyo de su familia lo que la fortalece cada día y su sueño es trabajando para salir adelante con su familia. 

She is asking for this loan to buy bloomers, socks, sandals, and shoes to stock her business for this Christmas season, so that she can increase her sales..  Eva has her family’s support and this strengthens her daily.  Her dream is to work to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Flor se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tambien al corte y confección, desde hace 3 años. Actividad que realiza desde su casa  de habitación, siendo sus principales clientes su amigos y vecinos de la comunidad y de otras colonias cercanas.
Doña Flor se caracteriza por  su amabilidad y prontitud en la entrega de sus trabajos de corte y confección y por eso sus clientes la prefieren, actualmente tiene poca ropa usada de venta y la demanda que tiene es mucha por la temporada navideña, por esta razón nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzoneta, suéteres, telas, botones y accesorios que necesita en la elaboración de trajes que es su segunda actividad.
Doña Flor es una persona  muy amable, sencilla y servicial, características que son necesarias para ganar más clientes y el buen funcionamiento de su negocio.


 
Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Flor has been selling used clothing and sewing for the past three years.   She works from her home and her main customers are her friends and neighbors from the community and other nearby neighborhoods.

Flor is known for her friendliness and quickness in delivering her customers’ sewing orders, so they prefer to use her services.  She currently has little used clothing for sale, but has a high demand because of the Christmas season, so she is asking for this loan to buy skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shirts, undergarments, sweaters, fabrics, buttons, and accessories she needs to make outfits; her second business activity.

Flor is a very friendly, simple, and servicing person.  These traits are necessary to win over new customers and have a good functioning business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and supplies.

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto, hombre trabajador, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hija, ella es comerciante de Ropa y Zapatos, entre los dos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar, el labora para una empresa privada desde hace mas de 6 años, su  meta a futuro es terminar de construir su casa y darle mejores condiciones a su hija. con este nuevo financiamiento comprara los siguientes materiales: Piedra, Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro. Agradece a Afodenic quen atravez de fondos Kiva la confianza y apoyo brindado para cumplir su sueño en realidad.
texts.en: Roberto is a hardworking man who lives in Ticuantepe with his wife and daughter.  She is a merchant and sells clothing and shoes.  Between the two of them, they support the household expenses.  He has been working for a private company for more than six years.  His future goal is to finish building his home and provide better living conditions for his daughter.  He will use the money from this loan to buy stone, cinder blocks, cement, sand, and iron bars.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the trust and support they have provided him in making his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Carlos de 38 años de edad conviviente más de 17 años con la señora Maxima, ambos saben leer y escribir, con 5 hijos dependientes que estudian, la familia vive en la comunidad de Corani Pampa-Colomi. Don Carlos y su esposa son personas trabajadores que cuentan con una actividad principal la producción agrícola de papa y locoto, aparte cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 2 lecheras, 2 de engorde más una vaquilla, motivo que don Carlos necesita un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y productos agroquímicos. Con esto quiere abonar o mejorar sus cultivos de locoto, quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos hacia el futuro como también apoyando en su estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Carlos is 38 years old and married to Maxima for more than 17 years.  Both know how to read and write.  They have five children who attend school.  This family lives in the Corani Pampa-Colomi community.  Carlos and his wife are hardworking people who farm and raise potatoes and locoto.  They also have some cows; two dairy cows, two beef cows, and a calf.  He is asking for this loan to buy compost and farming chemicals.  He wants to fertilize and improve his crops so that he can increase his income in the future, as well as support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Promise

texts.en:
Promise is married and has one child. She has received a Junior High education. Promise is a hairdresser at Wegbe near Hohoe. She has done this business for eight years now. Her husband is a farmer. Promise will use the loan to purchase a variety of hair products and equipment to improve the quality of service she renders to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Promise plans to increase her capital base.

In the photograph, Promise is working on the hair of one of her favorite costumers. Promise is the one standing.

loans.use: to purchase hair products and equipment

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: SILVERIO TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN LA ZONA DE LA MAICA, TIENE DOS HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, Y VIVE CON SU ESPOSA PRIMITIVA, EL TRABAJA EN DIFERENTES DEPARTAMENTOS DE BOLIVIA CON UNA EMPRESA QUE PRESTA SERVICIOS EN INSTALACIONES DE GASODUCTO.  SON PERSONAS MUY TRABAJADORAS QUE HAN PODIDO CRECER Y MEJORAR EN ALGO SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y LA DE SUS HIJOS CON EL CRÉDITO ANTERIOR QUE FUE OTORGADO PARA LA COMPRA DE TANQUE DE GAS PARA LA MOVILIDAD QUE ADQUIRIERON PARA TRABAJAR.  GRACIAS AL CAMBIO DE SISTEMA DE GAS, PUDIERON VENDER LA MOVILIDAD A UN BUEN PRECIO Y LOGRARON TERMINAR DE PAGAR UN LOTE DE TERRENO QUE ADQUIRIERON EN LA MAICA, AHORA ESTÁN CONSTRUYENDO SU CASITA POCO A POCO CON MANO DE OBRA PROPIA, YA TIENEN UNA HABITACIÓN Y COCINA Y QUIEREN TERMINAR LA PARTE DE LAS HABITACIONES DE SUS HIJOS PORQUE ESTÁN VIVIENDO EN UNA SOLA HABITACIÓN Y DE ESTA MANERA MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA FAMILIAR.
texts.en: Silverio is 38 years old and lives in the Macia zone.  He has two school aged children and lives with his wife, Primitiva.  He works in various departments in Bolivia, for a factory that provides gas line installation services. They are very hardworking people who were able to grow, and improve their children’s living conditions a bit with the help of the previous loan, which they used to buy a gas system.  They were able to sell the vehicle at a good price and were able to pay for a plot of land in Maica.  Now they are building a home, by their own labor, little by little.  Now that they have a home and kitchen, they want to complete the part of the house for their children, because they are currently all living in a single room.  In this way they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas pero en especial son la agricultura, crianza de animales los que comercializan en su cantón o en la ciudad, todas estas actividades les dan la oportunidad de mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven por el cantón Nabon que se encuentra ubicado al sudeste de la provincia del Azuay, una de sus características geográficas es la dispersión de su territorio, lo que impide un fácil acceso a las diferentes comunidades y dificulta la comunicación entre ellas, la actividad principal de sus habitantes es la agricultura, aun mantienen su vestimenta, su cultura y tradiciones,  es gente carismática, alegre y muy gentil. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Virginia, forma parte del banco comunal Entrada Chunazana desde hace 5 años, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 7 hijos, una de sus hijas es casada y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos se encuentran en el colegio, 2 en la escuela y sus dos últimos hijos aun son pequeños por lo que pasan en casa. Su esposo labora diariamente en el arte de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.

La Señora Virginia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas las que vende en su propia comunidad, cultiva sus terreno y la cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar, también confeciona polleras (vestimenta típica de la región).
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio propio como un restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Entrada a Chunazana communal bank is made up of seven women and one man who have different businesses, particularly farming and raising livestock which they sell in their settlement or in town.  All of these businesses give them the chance to improve their financial situation and move their families ahead.  They live in the Nabon settlement, located to the southeast of the Azuay province.  One of its geographic characteristics is the size of its territory, which makes access to and communication between different communities a bit difficult.  The inhabitants’ main activity is agriculture.  They still maintain their traditional clothing, culture, and traditions.  They are happy and very gentle people.

Virginia is one of the members of the “Entrada Chunazana” communal bank and has been for five years.  She is 39 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has seven children.  One of her daughters is married and on her own.  Two of their children attend school and two others are too young and are still at home.  Her husband is an artist and works daily as a mason.  They live in a home of their own.

Virginia raises pigs, Guinea pigs, and chickens and sells them in her own community.  She farms her land and harvests only for the family’s consumption.  She also makes “polleras” (a typical regional dress item)

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, thread, and feed for her animals.  Her dream is to have her own business, such as a restaurant because she enjoys food.  The small picture is that of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and feed.

loans.name: Blanca Elvia

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca forma parte del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada hace 2 años, viven por El Cantón de Nabón lugar que goza de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Blanca tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, un hijo es soltero quien tiene una discapacidad por lo que pasa en casa. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es propia.

La Señora. Blanca se dedica diariamente a los quehaceres de su hogar, como pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa trabaja cultivando sus terrenos y lo que cosecha vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad, también cría pollos, gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca has been part of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada for two years. They live in El Canton de Nabon, a place that enjoys beautiful landscapes thanks to its rugged terrain. Its people are very warm-hearted and still keep alive the flame of their culture and traditions.

Blanca is 44 years old. She is married and in her conjugal union she has conceived four children. Three of them are married and live independently. One son is single and has a disability because of which he stays at home. Her husband works as a laborer. The house in which she lives is her own.

Blanca works daily at the chores of her home. She spends the largest part of her time at home. She works at cultivating her land and what she harvests she sells in her community or in the city. She also raises chickens, hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of fertilizer and feed for her animals.

Her goal is to have more animals to sell and therefore improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra en cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, viven por El Cantón de Nabón lugar que goza de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, es una señora casada y ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil o jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cultivar sus terrenos, vende todos los productos que cosecha y así aporta a la economía de su hogar, también cría  gallinas, cuyes, borregos, cerdos y ganado del cual vende leche. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y en materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa. 

Su meta es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
This will be Maria’s fourth loan in the “Nuevo Bankito la Ramada” communal bank.  They live in the Nbon settlement, a place with beautiful landscapes thanks to its geography.  Its people have warm hearts and keep the fires of their culture and traditions burning.  Maria is 50 years old, married, and has nine children, six of who are married and on their own.  One of her children is in school and two attend a small local school.  Her husband works as a mason or laborer.  They have a home of their own.

Maria is a homemaker and cares for the farmland.  She sells all that she harvests and in this way helps the household financially.  She also raises chickens, Guinea pigs, sheep, pigs, and livestock from which she obtains milk to sell.

She will use the money from this new loan to buy feed for her animals and building materials for her home.  Her goal is to have her own business, like a store.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Doña Rosa ahora vende su comida en un mercado de Managua en donde está la mayor parte de su clientela, trabaja más que antes ya que es soltera tiene que mantener a sus hijos y su principal enfoque es que ellos culminen sus estudios profesionales, solicita este octavo crédito para comprar productos para el negocio como carnes, arroz, frijoles, frutas, verduras, sazonadores, gracias a estos préstamos  ha podido salir adelante con la educación de sus hijos y mejorar un poco su casa por lo que está muy agradecida por el apoyo constante que se le brinda por medio de Afodenic y Kiva.
texts.en: Rosa now sells her food in a market in Managua where most of her customers are. She works more than before because now that she's single she has to take care of her kids. Her main focus is for them to finish their schooling. She asks for this, her 8th loan, to buy products for her business like meats, rice, beans, fruits, vegetables and seasonings. Thanks to these loans she has been able to move forward with her children's education and make a few improvements to her house. For that reason she is very grateful for the constant support given to her by Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy meats, rice, beans, fruits, vegetables and seasonings.

loans.name: Carmen Alegria

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza  en el banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, viven por El Cantón de Nabon lugar que goza de paisajes hermosos gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Carmen tiene 51 años de edad, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Carmen pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa pero para solventar los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales como: borregos, cuyes y gallinas, también labora en la agricultura y sus cosechas las vende. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is on her fourth loan in Nuevo Bankito la Ramada Communal Bank.  They live in Nabón Canton, where the scenery is beautiful thanks to the rugged geography.  The people there are warm-hearted and still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Carmen, 51, is separated from her husband but had four children in her marriage.  Two of them are married and live independently, one works and helps her financially, and her last child studies in a school in town.  The house she lives in is her own.

Carmen spends most of her time at home but to pay for the household expenses she raises animals: sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She also works in agriculture and sells her harvests.

She's going to invest her new loan in buying guinea pigs, chickens, and construction materials to fix up her house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and construction materials

loans.name: Rita Ana

texts.es: Doña Rita con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio mantiene su negocio vendiendo comida en las calles para ayudar a sus 2 hijos quienes estudian, ella siendo una madre soltera está haciendo el sacrificio para construir un muro perimetral de su casa y tener mayor seguridad, para lograrlo solicita apoyo de crédito por segunda ocasión con lo que comprara bloques, cemento, piedra cantera, hierro, arena y pagar la mano de obra, el mayor deseo de doña Rita es tener su propio comedor en un mercado de Managua para apoyar más a su familia y seguir creciendo con sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja arduamente para poder lograrlo.
texts.en: Rita keeps her business going with great effort and sacrifice.  She sells food in the streets to help her two children who attend school.  Being a single mother, she is making the sacrifice to build a wall around her house so they can feel more secure.  She is asking for a loan, her second, so that she can buy cinder blocks, cement, iron bars, sand, and pay for labor.  Rita’s greatest desire is to have her own food stall in the Managua market so that she can support her family and continue to grow with her children.  This is why she works arduously to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Ms Maryam, 28 years old, decided to work after completing her studies to support her family to have a better future. She started her own academy two years ago with the help of her sister. Initially, she had 20 to 25 students in different grades; now the number of students has increased. Parents of students are very much satisfied with Maryam's teaching style.  

In order to accommodate more students, Maryam needs to purchase furniture for the academy. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy chairs, benches and tables for the children. This will create a means of increasing revenue to generate a healthier source of income. Maryam wants to use the extra amount of profit to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy chairs, benches and tables for the children.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Ms Kiran, a 28-year-old married mother of two, has been involved in the business of hand embroidery for many years. She spends endless hours preparing embroidered shirts that her husband sells in the market place. She also receives many orders from the people in her vicinity, earning enough to contribute to the family income.

In order to complete orders on time, Kiran needs to purchase quality fabric with packs of sequins, threads and pearls in many colors. For this she is requesting her fourth loan from Kashf Foundation for Rs. 40000. This will increase her profit margin which she will utilize for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase quality fabric with packs of sequins, threads and pearls in many colors.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.ru: Нарзулло мужчина в возрасте 37 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Занимается воспитанием детей но в свободное время старается помогать мужу по откармливанию скота. Нарзулло в своём кишлаке работает на заказ водителем легковой автомашины, на проведение свадебных мероприятий, загса а также откармливает скот у себя дома. Основной его доход от откорма и продажи скота. У него сейчас тридцать баранов и двадцать коз. Нарзулло недавно построил хлев для своего скота, на зиму. Поэтому пока скот не подорожал, он хочет увеличить поголовье скота. На полученный кредит Нарзулло планирует купить еще овец и коз. Он благодарит организацию Кива за поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Narzullo is a 37 year old man.  He is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker and she raises the children, but in her spare time she tries to help her husband with his business of fattening cattle.  Narzullo works in and around the village as a driver for hire taking people to and from wedding events and the civil registy office.  At home, he fattens cattle for resale.  His primary income is from fattening and selling cattle.  Right now, he has 30 rams and 20 goats.  Narzullo recently built a barn for keeping his cattle during the winter.  

Narzullo wants to increase the size of his herd before the price of cattle goes up.  He is planning to buy more sheep and goats with the loan proceeds.  Narzullo thanks Kiva for supporting him in his hour of need.

loans.use: to purchase of sheep and goats

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en:
Choun, 27, is single. She lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main source of her family’s income comes from farming rice. Choun has been running her business for 10 years, earning about KHR 26,000 per day and she is able to save about 20,000 each day.
 
Choun’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Nay, 57, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has six children, two of whom are dependent on her and help the family’s business. To make a living, Nay has been farming rice, planting cabbage and garlic for thirty years.
Nay has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycle. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough foods. Now she is requesting another loan of US$1,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation. Nay hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a loving mother of five children. She weaves rugs and has been in business for 10 years.

Musarat has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and her husband also helps her.  She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence.  She also sews on a part time basis.  In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Musarat has built a successful business.  She has been associated with Kashf for six years. 

At present, Musarat requests a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy raw materials such as wool, threads, cutters, and tools to expand her business.  It will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help her bring more cash home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool, threads, cutters, and tools.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Nem is a 60-year-old widowed mother of two children. For four years she has been struggling to feed her children by selling fish in the local area.

Nem is requesting her first loan with VisionFund, while the other group member has received three previous loans. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more fish to resell. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She raises chickens, and her husband supplements her income by working for others for a fee. Having been in business for five years, together they earn about 30,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.  
This is Sophea's first loan cycle with VisionFund. The other member has been a borrower with VisionFund before. Sophea is leading her group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes to fatten her chickens so that she can sell them for good prices in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Chhoern's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Chhoern is 55 years-old and has six children. Chhoern is a rice farmer in the local area and she has been in this business for thirty years to support her family. The current business earns her about 25,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 8,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chhoern is a first cycle client with VisionFund while the other member is a third cycle client. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in ploughing the paddy-field.  She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, aged 57, living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district has nine children, one of whom is still dependent on her and still in school. She has been selling snacks for thirty-one years and her husband works as a paid worker in a local area. Together, she and her husband can earn about 48,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Saret has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. She fully paid back the past loans which have helped her to alleviate her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. Saret, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a pot for making snacks and use a portion to spend on buying school materials to support her child’s education. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy a pot for making snacks

loans.name: Phany's Group

texts.en:
Phany, 33, lives with her husband and two children in a village in Ek Phnom in Battambang province, Cambodia. Both of her children, one daughter and one son, are still in school. To make a living, Phany has worked as a tailor for 12 years. The business currently earns her about 33,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Phany’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for five cycles. She fully paid back her past loans. The loans helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve the family's livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fabric and other materials for her tailoring business. She hopes to earn more income from her business to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fabric and other materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a hard-working lady, and she is very eager to help her husband. The man shown in the photo is Yasmeen’s husband, who runs a small internet cafe. He has years of experience in this field. Yasmeen also sews clothes for the people of her community to contribute to the family income.  She is the mother of three and motivated to provide for her family.

In order to purchase computers and some furniture, such as tables and chairs, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20000 for her husband’s internet cafe business, where he wants to expand in order to earn more and meet the needs of his family. Yasmeen is hoping to increase their net income, which they intend to use on the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to purchase computers and some furniture, such as tables and chairs, for her husband's internet cafe.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been running a successful general store for five years with the support of her husband, who is shown in the photo with her. They started their business on a very small level and expanded it gradually. Over time they have retained many regular customers. To stock her store more fully, Saima has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf for the fifth time. She intends to use this money to purchase sacks of rice and flour, and packs of cleaning products.  She wishes to spend part of her revenue on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and flour, and packs of cleaning products.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is a 36-year-old lady. Her husband is living abroad for employment, but he is not settled yet. She is a loving mother of four children, and due to her husband not being settled yet, her husband's income is not sufficient to meet their daily expenses and the educational expenses of their children.
 
For the bright future of her children, she decided to start her own business three years ago: a clothing sales business at her home. She is now willing to expand her business to other shops so that she can meet the demands of her clients and better earn for her family. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good credit behavior. Now, she demands a loan of Rs 30,000 for purchasing a variety of clothing for ladies and gentlemen. She expects a boost in her earnings, which she wishes to spend on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for ladies and gentlemen

loans.name: Gjergj

texts.en:
Gjergj is 49 years old and has four children; three from his previous marriage and one from the second. His first wife passed away in a tragic accident, leaving the children at a very young age, without motherly support. They live in northeastern Albania in a rural village.

This is the second loan for Gjergj from the same institution with the previous one being paid off. This time, he is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow to feed his family and sell as well. He plans on adding more dairy cows in the near future, because he wants to build a livestock business. He has realized that selling dairy products and baby animals can be profitable, especially in the northern part of the country where dairy and bread are considered staple food items for all of the population.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Ms Nadia is a 32-year-old married lady. She has been running a business of yarn-making with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nadia’s husband. They have become famous in their community for providing good-quality yarn. Ms Nadia is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. For higher productivity of yarn, Nadia has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This loan amount will help her to purchase some tools and good-quality fibre from the market at lower rates. In this way, her sales would increase, which will ultimately help in generating more cash for the home.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and good-quality fibre for her yarn-making business

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Ms. Shakeela is a 47-year-old married woman. She is striving hard to meet her family's demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income. 

She has been in the business of sewing for two years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Ms Rani is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 34 years old and mother of two children. Her husband sells crockery, but his income is not sufficient for family, so Balqees established a small general store in a corner of her home. It has been 16 years since she started her business. Her son also assists her by dealing with the customers. She believes in keeping the shop open for the maximum number of hours to deal with the maximum number of customers. People prefer to shop at her store for buying products of daily use. 

Balqees has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 so that she can buy pulses (pulses are edible legume seeds, such as lentils, beans and chickpeas), sugar, cold drinks, etc. She has been in association with Kashf for three years and dreams to provide her children with a prosperous and bright future.

loans.use: to buy pulses, sugar, cold drinks, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Zahoor
