El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa y cosméticos) que adquirirá del departamento de Oruro por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Jesus Redentor” begins its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana center, and is made up of eight members, and directed by a board of directors.  Jhuly is the president and the members have different businesses including: cosmetic sales, neighborhood stores, assorted products, plants, and flower pots, eiderdown, bookstores, and fried pork rinds.

This loan will benefit small businesses including Jhuly’s.  This will be her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of an adviser who visited her in her home.  She currently has a business where she sells clothing and cosmetics.  She learned this business on her own because it generated good returns.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and cosmetics in bulk in the Oruro department.  She will resell them from her space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family; she’s in a common law marriage and has a son.
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Allin Llankaqcuna De Chichubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALLIN LLANKAQCUNA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; Este banco está  ubicado en  la comunidad de Chichubamba,provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia  ella es casada, tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva años en este negoció el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que las le solicitan, a la vez la socia se dedica a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, maestro constructor, venta de artesanía, moto taxi, elaboración de chocolate, venta de flores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “ALLIN LLANKAQCUNA DE CHICHUBAMBA” communal bank, located in the Chichubamba community of the Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Julia is married; she’s 40 years old and has three children.  She raises small animals such as Guinea pigs, and chickens and has been doing it for several years.  Things are going well because of all of the dedication she puts into her business each day.  She raises these animals and later sells them to her customers who request them from her.  She is also a farmer, and a responsible person who gets her family ahead in this way.

She is asking for this loan to buy Guinea pigs for her business.

The other members farm, raise small animals, work in construction, sell art, drive moto-taxis, make chocolate, and sell flowers.
[Julia] appreciates those who form a part of this dream through this means and promises to be on time with her payments.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es:
El señor Antonio tiene 61 años de edad, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el viven sus hijas y su esposa quienes le apoyan  en  sus actividades comerciales. 
Don Antonio su negocio es servicio de molino actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años en la ciudad donde vive, su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, ya que esta en el centro  de su colonia donde vive y esto hace que sea muy visitado por su clientes a los cuales les brinda su servicio desde hace muchos años. 
Don Antonio el crédito lo necesita para la compra de un molino por que el que tiene ya esta deteriorado, el impacto esperado con el crédito es poder satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes y brindarle una mejor servicio a cada uno de ellos. 
Don Antonio sus planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial y ser uno de los mejores en su región y de esta manera generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él como para su familia.
Reina vende ropa clasificada.
Edith tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas.
Mirna tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas.

Choluteca, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Antonio is 61 years old and lives in southern Honduras, along with his wife and children, whom encourage him in his business. 

Antonio offers milling services and has done this for 20 years in his city.  His business is in a strategic location because it’s in the center of his neighborhood and is well visited by his customers, to whom he has provided good service for many years.

Antonio needs this loan to buy a mill because the one he has is worn out.  This loan will help him satisfy his customer demand and provide better service to each one of them.

Antonio’s plans for the future are to continue growing his business and become one of the best in his region.  In this way he can increase his earnings and provide a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

Reina sells clothing
Edith has a tortilla business.
Mirna has a tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Prosperidad2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROSPERIDAD”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de macramé, venta de ovejas y de cordero, venta de materiales de plástico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Ana María es parte integrante, ella indica que hace diez y seis ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de bordados de traje de caporal (danza autóctona de Bolivia), cuenta que hace años aprendió este negocio al ingresar a trabajar como ayudante, posteriormente la le confiaban los materiales para que elabore en su domicilio, por ello decide hacer apertura de su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de perlas y telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “PROSPERIDAD” community bank is in its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada center.  It is made up of eight members, and is directed by a board of directors where Basilina serves as president.  The members have various businesses, including macramé, sheep and lamb selling, and plastic item sales.

This loan will benefit small businesses of different trades, including Ana Maria’s.  She says that she has been with Pro Mujer for ten cycles, having joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  She has a caporal dress (native Bolivian dance) embroidery business and learned this by working as an assistant.  Later they trusted her with the supplies and allowed her to work from home so she wants to set up her own work space.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pearls and fabric in bulk and make and sell from her work area.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her household; she is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health benefits.

loans.use: to buy pearl and fabric.

loans.name: Las Comerciantes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las comerciantes está conformado por 10 mujeres quienes se dedican a la venta de  diferentes mercaderías, todas trabajan en un mercado de la ciudad y día a día ofrecen sus productos a sus clientes, sus metas son sacar adelante a sus familias y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad cuenta con un clima frió, su geografía accidentada la hace una ciudad hermosa, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gerardina este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Las Comerciantes. Tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos, uno de sus hijos es casado y independiente, su segundo hijo que tiene 13 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Gerardina es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, vende  solo los días que hay de feria en la ciudad, los demás días pasa en su casa y se dedica al cuidado de su familia. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para incrementar su mercadería.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Las Commerciantes” communal bank is made up of 10 ladies who sell various types of merchandise.  The all work in the city market and offer their products to their customers on a daily basis.  Their collective goal is to get their families ahead and provide their children with a better future.

They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca; this city has a cold climate and its varying geography makes this a beautiful city.  It’s been designated as a World Heritage Site since 1999 and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Geranrdina is one of its members and this is her third loan through “Las Comerciantes.”  She is 50 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is married and on his own.  Her youngest son is 13 years old and attends a local school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They live in a rented house.

Gerardina is a merchant who has been selling clothing for 10 years, but only on days when there is a fair in town.  She spends the rest of the time caring for the family at home.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing to increase the amount of merchandise.  Her dream is to have a home of their own.

loans.use: to buy clothing,

loans.name: Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUAYNA POTOSI”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de promoción, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de golosinas, tejido de awayos, venta de carne, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado y de carne, negocio que implemento hace varios años a recomendación de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las ferias provinciales y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Venancia ya que tuvo que pasar al consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The “HUAYNA POTOSI” communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  The group is made up of ten members and directed by a board of directors.  Maxima serves as the president.  The members have different businesses, including promotional product sales, bread sales, food sales, snack sales, awayo knitting, meat, potatoes, and chuño.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Maxima’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for two cycles and joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She sells cattle and started this business a few years ago on her parent’s recommendation. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy livestock in the provincial fairs and sell it on order.  This work will allow her to generate income to support her household.  She is in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and financing.

Venancia is not shown in the photograph because she had to go to the doctor.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dedicación ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son siliconas para autos, parabrisas, retrovisores entre otros, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la ganadería, mueblería, carpintería, venta de artesanía,   confeccion, venta de quesos, brindando el servicio de taxi.
Los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN.  This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, belonging to the province of Cusco and in the subdivision department of Cusco.  

The featured member is Dedicación.  She lives with her partner, is thirty-eight years old, and has three children.  Her daily activities in her business include the selling of spare car parts.  She has a good time in her business and everything is going well thanks to the determination she brings each day to her business.  

She sells silicone parts for cars, like windshields and rearview mirrors, among others.  She works together with her partner, feeling that in this way she is able to move forward with her family.

She requests a loan to buy windshields for her business.

The other members make a living in livestock farming, making furniture, carpentry, selling artisan crafts, pastries, selling cheeses, and offering taxi services.  The group members that appear in the thumbnail photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work schedules.

Dedicación gives thanks to those who are part of her dream through this medium and promises to comply with the payments in the prescribed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy windshields for her business.

loans.name: Ollitas De Barro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OLLITAS DE BARRO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, lavado de ropa, medicina natural, bordado de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural, negocio que implemento trabaja hace varios años por recomendación de su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de emulsiones y hiervas) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ollitas de Barro" will starts its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of six members and is directed by a directing board where Felicidad is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: meat sales, vegetable sales, a neighborhood store, washing clothes, natural medicine, and embroidery of sweaters. The loan they take out will benefit the small business owners, and Felicidad is one of them. She says that this is the first cycle as part of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation of a representative of the institution who came to visit her in her home. 

Currently she has a business selling natural medicine, a business she has been doing for several years on the recommendation on her husband. The loan she will take out now is to increase capital to buy emulsions and herbs, which she will get at the traditional festivals and later sell at the festivals in the city of El Alto. This kind of work lets her generate resources to support her home as much as possible, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy emulsions and herbs

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa es casada su esposo es jubilado y con sus ingresos ayuda en los gastos del hogar, de sus 5 hijos ya tres son independientes y apoyan a sus padres dos estan estudiando, doña Josefa era maestra pero afortunadamente le ascendieron de puesto como secretaría administrativa en el colegio donde trabaja, continua utilizando sus créditos para mejoras de vivienda esta vez construirá el muro perimetral de su casa, para eso necesita comprar cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y pagar la mano de obra e ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida junto a su unida familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is married and her husband is retired. The income they receive helps with the household expenses. Three of their five children are independent and support their parents. The other two are studying.

Doña Josefa was a teacher, but fortunately she was promoted to the position of administrative secretary at the school where she works. She continues to utilize her loans for home improvements. This time she will build a wall around her house. She needs to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, as well as pay for labor. Josefa continues to make gradual improvements to the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha ha sabido salir adelante con sus hijos siendo madre soltera hoy gracias a Dios ya todos están grandes y le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar, continua siempre con su  trabajo de conserje en un colegio y también en el pequeño kiosco donde vende golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales para los niños cuando están en receso,  ella ha utilizado sus créditos para invertir en este negocio y ahora lo necesita para mejoras de su casa que le heredo su mamá, comprara laminas de zinc y perlines para el porche ya que poco a poco irá construyendo su casita de concreto para que sea más duradera y así vivir en buenas condiciones con su familia, todo será posible gracias al apoyo que Afodenic y Kiva le brinda por el cual está muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Martha is a single mother who knows how to help her children move forward. Thanks to God, all of her children are now grown and help her with the household duties. Martha continues in her work as a janitor at a school. She also manages a small kiosk where she sells snacks, sodas, and natural beverages to the children during recess. Martha has used her loans to invest in her business, but now she needs to make improvements to the house she inherited from her mother.

She will buy sheets of zinc and crossbeams for the porch. By proceeding gradually with the building improvements to her concrete house, she will make it more durable and provide better conditions for her family. All of this has been made possible with the support of AFODENIC and Kiva, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc and crossbeams for fixing her porch.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, age 30, and one of a family head, is a mother of a schoolchild and a small daughter. She and the rest of her family are living in the Pursat Province’s Kror Kor District. 

Hun has three hectares of rice farmland and a small stall for selling grocery items, from which she is able to earn up to 30,700 KHR per day as the main sources of the family’s income. She has been with this business for ten years. 

Hon has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles. After the past loan that she has paid back completely, she feels so confident that she can sustain her living in a proper manner. Additionally, the past loan has helped her to buy a water pump for supporting her farmland and it is really useful for her cash crop, especially during the dry season. 

Now, Hon is seeking 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use it to buy fertilizer and additional grocery items to replenish her selling business. She does believe that this purchase will help her to gain more output and income so that she can keep her children in school until a higher level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farming and additional grocery items to replenish her selling business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 34-year-old married man and has 2 children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a helpful man and always feels happy with people. He loves to work and hates to be unemployed. 

He collected money to buy a taxi, which is used to improve his living standards. Actually, he thought the amount is not enough to buy a taxi, so he applied for a loan of 600,000 YER from AMB to buy a taxi to use for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a taxi to use for transportation

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en: Rafat is 38 years old, married, and has four children. They live in Aden, Yemen. Rafat has been operating an optical business, where he sells defferent qualities of eyeglass frames and lenses. He started his business five years ago with a small amount to enlarge his business. Since that time, he was able to attract many customers, and he wants to expand his business with more optical supplies. He applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy eyeglasses and lenses for his business. He hopes to buy testing device lenses in the future to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy eyeglasses and lenses for his business.

loans.name: Blanca Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa,  es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando en la escuela y colegio públicos, hace dos con el apoyo de su hermana decidieron abrir una pequeña pulpería, donde vende arroz, huevos, refrescos, papel higiénico, pañales y otros.
Doña Blanca con los ingresos que ha obtenido ha ido comprando productos, pero todavía le falta bastante que comprar, mantienen sus clientes que son en su mayoría los vecinos y personas que transitan por un pequeño centro comercial que esta frente a su casa.
Doña Blanca tiene poco inventario y como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para invertir, está solicitando el préstamo de 15,000.00 lempiras para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, salsas, pastas, leches, mantequilla, margarina, jabón y papeles higiénicos.
Doña Blanca uno de sus sueños es ampliar el espacio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the city of Tegucigalpa. She is a single mother with two children, which are studying in public school and college. With the support of her sister, she decided to open a small grocery store where she sells rice, eggs, soft drinks, toilet paper, diapers, and other products.

With the profits, Blanca has been buying products, but still does not have enough to meet the demand of her clients. The majority of her clients are neighbors and people passing by the small shopping center in front of her home.

Blanca has little inventory and does not have sufficient capital to invest. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras ($775) to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, salsas, pasta, milk, butter, margarine, soap, and toilet paper.

One of Blanca's dreams is to expand her space and to be able to offer her clients a variety of products.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – November, 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee and other products for her business.

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: An inhabitant from Kror Kor district of Pursat province and a mother of four children, Siv is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectares of farmland. Her husband helps to make more income through producing brown sugar from sugar palm juice. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 22,500 Riels (KHR) per day. Siv's past loan was the original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has used it in a smart manner to upgrade her living conditions and managed to save some money for her needs in the future. Now, she is seeking 3,000,000 KHR to add to her savings in order to buy a decent motorbike for supporting her business. She hopes that this purchase will help her to reduce transportation expenses that she used to have.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for supporting her business

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
A married father, originally from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sophat is a local farmer and a carpenter. To supplement the family’s income, his wife also tailors clothes. Sophat has been engaging in his current business for five years. He is a fourth-time borrower and joins a group of two, with a second-time borrower, to seek for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. His living is improving gradually from the past loans, which he has paid back with success. Now, he is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while his co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR. 

As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy sewing materials for his wife's business and to buy fertilizer for his cornfield. He hopes to increase their income so as he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for supporting his wife's business.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A hardworking farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sophal is the father of a small son who is too young for schooling. To make a living, he grows rice and peanuts, with his wife as a helper. For the 10 years that he has been with this business, he has been able to earn up to 16,000 KHR per day. 

In a group of three, Sophal has just joined VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) this cycle, while his other two co-borrowers have been with VisionFund for at least three cycle loans. The total requested loan amount of his microloan group is 1,700,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is for Sophal. He will use this portion to buy fertilizer for his peanut farmland. He hopes to boost the output of his farm on time, so he can make more income for his family - especially his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his peanut farmland.

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en: Cheat , a divorced father of one schoolchild, is originally from Battambang province, Phat is 31 years old and a farmer who grows rice on two hectare of farmland. He supplements the family income by catching fish for resale. He has been with this business for four years.  This is the first micro loan for Cheat with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is seeking 1,500,000 KHR to buy potash and gasoline for pumping water for his farmland. He hopes that he can support his business in a timely manner so that he can make more income from it, improve his living conditions and keep his only daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy potash and gasoline for pumping water

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: A father of four children, Chea is 59 years old and resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, where rice growing is a common business for the villagers in the area. Currently, two children still reply on him as they are still in school. He and his wife grow rice in order to provide for the daily expenses of their household. During his spare time, he also works as a motor-taxi driver for additional income. He has been involved in this business for 4 years, and he is able to earn up to 27,900 KHR per day. This is his sixth loan with VisionFund. He has wisely used his past loans with success, as they helped him to better support his business as well as his living conditions. Now, he is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and rice seed for the upcoming planting season. He hopes that he can grow his rice in a timely manner and produce a greater crop yield, so he can keep improving his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Al-Amana Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Amana, which consists of four ladies who live in Haja, Yemen. Mriam is 34 years old, a married woman, and has eight children who live in Haja, Yemen. She is a responsible woman who is interested in giving her children a good life. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine for her home. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for her home

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat, a father of four little sons and originally from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, is 31 years old. Together with his wife, the family’s sources of income are from rice farming, grocery selling, and paid work at a construction site. These multiple businesses earn him about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Sarat has just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. He is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy more items to replenish his grocery selling business. He hopes that this purchase will refill his selling business on time and return him a double income so that he can expand this business on a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Savit

texts.en: Savit, 42, is a rural citizen from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province where rice farming is a common business in the area. Like her neighbors, she also grows rice to earn a daily living. To supplement the family’s income, she also makes sugar from sugar palm trees. Both of these businesses, which she has been doing for 20 years, have returned her about 12,200 KHR per day. For this cycle, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans have better supported her business and kept improving her living conditions. Now, she is seeking a loan of 700,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to add up on her saving in order to buy a decent motorbike for her business’s sake. She hopes that this purchase will help her to reduce the transportation fee which she currently has to spend.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Adama. She is married and has one child, aged 3. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sales assistant.  

In 2011, Adama established her bagged rice business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Le. 

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of rice for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her business to grow and maximize profit for expansion. In the future, Adama plans to open a savings account, educate her children and to become a supplier of rice. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Hani Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hani. It consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER.

Zainb is 33 years old, married, and has six children. She is a housewife who owns a small house. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Creater Group

texts.en: This group is called Creater which consists of two ladies and two men who live in Aden, Yemen. Fatima is 41 years old, and married with two children who live together in Aden. she has been selling different products, like clothes and perfumes, for nine years. She started her business selling vegetables and food. She and her husband are the breadwinners for their family. She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes and perfumes. She hopes to enlarge her sales to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 22 year old, single man who lives in Aden, Yemen. He has been operating an electrical materials store for many years. He started his business by renting a small shop, but thanks to the good way he’s managed the income from his business, he was able to obtain financing and expanded his business. He has employed two people, who help him to work well and get more clients. 

So, Omar is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy electrical materials like lamps, wires and fans to stock his store. This loan is the second loan which will be funded from Kiva . He thanks Kiva for financing him in the first loan. His goal is to make his business grow, turning it into a big store which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy electrical stock for his business.

loans.name: Ramdhan Kaream Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramdhan Kaream and consists of four women and one man who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Sameera is 40 years old and has five children. She is a tailor who makes high dresses for her clients. She offers good services to her clients. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Bella Alegria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad.

Doña Bella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sandalias. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
La Sirena Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sirena neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its nice beaches that people visit year round and for being an incomparably beautiful city with a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Bella lives.  She's 55 years old and married, and from this relationship has two adult children who are independent.  Her husband works in a company in the city.

Bella's a housewife who wants to have her own resources to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, so she sells clothing, sandals, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works two or three hours a day three days a week.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She has worked in this job for more than eight years and it's going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and sandals.  This is her fifth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and sandals

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en: This is 48 year-old Abu-Bakarr. He is married and has four children ages 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old. In 2010, Abu-Bakarr established his Pure Water Company business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his livelihood and be self-reliant. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are the general community. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Abu-Bakarr requires a loan to buy more water plastic, water tanks and other materials for resale. In the future, Abu-Bakarr plans to become an international businessman and build a factory to help others. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more water plastic, water tanks and other materials for resale.

loans.name: Gissela Cesibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Gissela, tiene 23  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 años y el menor de 9 meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una empresa constructora. 

Doña Gissela con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, trabaja de tres a cuatros  días a la semana en sus recorridos ya que su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos ya que su mamá se hace cargo de sus hijos que son muy pequeños, ella lleva casi un año en este negocio que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco, el cual le ayuda a mejorar su vida.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños ya que se viene la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y sus ventas mejoran. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio con el cual se siente independiente.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
La Sirena Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sirena neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its nice beaches that people visit year round and for being an incomparably beautiful city with a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Gissela lives.  She's 23 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has two children, ages 4 and 9 months.  Her husband works in a construction company.

Gissela sells clothing via catalogue so she can have her own income and be able to pay for her expenses and help at home.  She sells door-to-door three or four days a week in the morning.  It's easier for her to make her rounds in the morning because her mother takes care of her children, who are very young.  She has been doing this job for almost a year.  She started it with the first loan she received from the bank, which helps her improve her life.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing  because the Christmas and New Year season is approaching and her sales improve.  She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because she used it to start her business, which makes her feel independent.

Her dream is to have her own house because where she lives is rented.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Petita Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive a la señora Petita, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 11 Y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de pescado.

Doña Petita con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar en los gastos de estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días unas dos horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a lo que deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 4 años  en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
  
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 ciclos  y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
La Sirena Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sirena neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its nice beaches that people visit year round and for being an incomparably beautiful city with a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Petita lives.  She's 33 years old and married, and has three children from this relationship, ages 15, 11, and 9.  The two older ones are in high school and the younger one is in school.  Her husband sells fish.

With the goal of having her own income to be able to help with her children's educational expenses, Petita earns a living selling products through Avon and Lebel catalogues (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door for an hour or two every day.  She leaves her products on credit and charges every week or two according to what the customers want.  She has been doing this job for more than four years and it's going very well for her.
  
She's going to use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and all types of clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for seven loan cycles and she likes it because of the profits and the other loans the institution offers.

Her dream is to have her own house because where she lives is rented.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Idalba Pederosa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
La señora Idalba, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una hija de 12 años la misma que estudia en un colegio de la localidad. Su marido es comerciante. 

Doña Idalba tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, a ella le gusta tener de todo en su local vende desde víveres, carnes, legumbres, ciertos  remedios, bisutería y cosas de bazar ya que esto le da ganancias extras, actualmente también está vendiendo helados de una marca muy reconocida además de recargas telefónicas, ella cada vez que puede va mejorando su negocio y esto gracias a los créditos que recibe de la institución,  trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él puede. Lleva 15  años que tiene su  negocio y es así como ella sale adelante con su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en surtir más su tienda con productos como: arroz, azúcar, detergentes, aceites, enlatados, etc. Esta casi desde el inicio en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede mejora su local.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
In the community of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí--which has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds--the members of the communal bank "La California" meet every two weeks.

Ms. Idalba, who is 50 years old, is married and has a 12 year-old daughter who studies at a local high school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Ms. Idalba has a grocery shop in her home. She likes to have a little of everything at her shop, where she sells groceries, meats, vegetables, medicines, and miscellaneous items. For extra money, she also sells a well-known brand of ice cream and telephone calling cards. Whenever she can, she improves her business thanks to the loans she has received from this institution. Ms. Idalba works with the help of her husband when he is able. She has had her business for 15 years, and it is through this that she will help her family get ahead.

Ms. Idalba will use this loan to stock her shop with products such as: rice, sugar, detergent, oil, canned goods, etc. She has been with the communal bank almost from the beginning, and she likes it because she can use the loan money to improve her business.
 
Her goal is to have a much larger shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergent, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dolores Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
La señora Dolores tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es taxista. 

Doña Dolores es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa donde trabaja todos los días, prepara desayunos, almuerzos y en ciertos días también meriendas, ella siempre varia el menú más o menos conociendo los gustos de sus clientes, también los  domingos prepara el delicioso caldo de gallina criolla, el delicioso caldo de pata y el seco de pescado picudo ya que estos platos son los preferidos por sus clientes, trabaja con la ayuda de  su hermana a quien le paga por su trabajo, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido mejorar su negocio. 

Su sueño es  tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The members of La California Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Nueva California residential development in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds. 

Sra. Dolores is 42 years old, married and has two children, 17 and 12 years old, who are students. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Doña Dolores is a woman who likes to get ahead on her own merits. She has a small restaurant in her home where she works everyday, preparing breakfasts, lunches and, on certain days, light meals. She always varies the menu since she knows, more of less, the tastes of her clients. Also, she prepares a delicious Creole chicken soup, a delicious duck soup and dried swordfish on Sundays because these dishes are preferred by her customers. She is helped by her sister, whom she pays for her work. She has run this business for more than 8 years and it gives her a great deal of satisfaction.

This loan is to purchases the ingredients to prepare her food. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than two years and she enjoys it because of the loans, which have enabled her to improve her business.

Her dream is to own a large restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local foodstuffs for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks for his business.

loans.name: Hassan Oyollah

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Hassan. He is married and has one child, age five. He has one additional dependent, living with him as a sales assistant.

In 2002, Hassan established his building materials business. He began the business because he wanted to take care of his family. Hassan's business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are men. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.

Hassan requires a loan in order to increase his available stock. He hopes that this loan will help him by increasing his stock and earning him more profits. In the future, Hassan plans to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more building materials for his business.

loans.name: Leída Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los cuatro que tiene ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer tiene un tanquero y una volqueta.

Doña Leída es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de material pétreo y venta de agua en tanquero, ella también en su casa tiene un negocio de venta de sodas, aguas y otras bebidas negocio el cual atiende ya que es en su casa y no la distrae de sus ocupaciones domesticas.  Por el sector por donde ellos viven no hay agua potable y así aprovecha su esposo de venderles a las personas que necesitan de este líquido vital. Su esposo lleva dedicado a este negocio más de 16 años con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar agua y material pétreo. Está en el banco comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el banco.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro nuevo.
texts.en:
The community bank of Colorado has a meeting every 15 days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts.  It is the place known for the famous Panama hats. 

This is the place where Leída lives.  She is 68 years old, is married, and had six children with her husband.  Two of her children passed away, and the other four are grown.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband works as truck driver.  He has a tanker truck and a dump truck.  

Leída is a very good wife who is requesting the loan for her husband’s business.  He works selling stone as well as water from his tanker truck.  

She also has a business that she runs out of her home, selling soda, water, and other beverages.  She tends to this business because it is run out of her home, and it does not get in the way of her domestic responsibilities.  

In the area where they live there is no potable water, and her husband  takes advantage of this by selling this vital liquid to the people who need it.  Her husband has worked in this business for more than 16 years, which has gotten their family ahead.  This loan is for the purchase of water and stone.

Leída has been a part of the community bank since its inception and she likes the help that the bank has given them.   

Her dream is to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to buy water and stone.

loans.name: Ketty Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Ketty es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 1 años de edad, los dos  mayores  estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Doña Ketty además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica al comercio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas y hasta donde llegan sus clientes,  también trabaja a base de pedidos. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todo los fines de semana en las mañanas, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que  necesita. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Colorado" meets every 15 days in Colorado, in the canton of Montecristi.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are known at the national and international level.  This is where the famous "Panama Hats" made of woven straw are made.

Ketty is one of the founding members of the communal bank.  She likes being a member, because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  Ketty is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 10, 7 and 1.  Her two oldest children are in school, and her husband works as a taxi driver.

In addition to being a great mother and wife, Ketty is a businesswoman who sells all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door, and she also sells from her house where she has some glass display cases and where she receives her customers.  She also works on the basis of orders.  She works 3 days a week, mostly during the weekends in the morning.  She sells on credit and collects every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise each time she needs it.  She's had this business for more than 10 years, and it is going very well.

Ketty will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

Ketty's dream is that her children will always have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada, y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años que estudia el primer año de escuela. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada.

Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganar su propios recursos para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella con la ayuda de su esposo construyeron un pequeño galpón en el cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos, empezó con muy poco y ahora tiene más de 70 chanchos entre grandes y pequeños, ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres y hermanos para la alimentación y cuidado de los animales, vende los chanchos pequeños y grandes a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, lleva más de 5 años con este negocio y gracias a esto ella le ayuda a su esposo y también a sus hermanos ya que les paga por su trabajo y ellos así pueden llevar algo para sus hogares.

Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para los chanchos. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que otorga la institución a sus clientes.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The 'De Colorado' community bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, in Montecristi canton.  This area is noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is where María lives.  She is 26 years old, married, and has a 5-year-old son who is in his first year of school.  Her husband works for a private company.

María is a very tenacious woman who enjoys earning her own money so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.  With the help of her husband, she managed to build a small shed where she raises pigs.  She started out with very few animals and now has more than 70 pigs, some big and some small.  She has the help of her parents and siblings in feeding and caring for the animals.  She sells large and small pigs to tradespeople who come to her home to buy.  She has been in this business for more than 5 years and, thanks to her work, she is able to help her husband and also her siblings as she pays them for their work which means they can help support their own households.

María will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides to its clients.

María's dream is to provide her young son with the best in life.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine

loans.name: Deice Mireya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la  señora Deice, Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer tiene un bus.

Doña Deice es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también le mandan desde Colombia. Tiene 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad  que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para aprovechar la época de la Navidad y Año Nuevo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. 

Su sueño es ver que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The 'De Colorado' community bank meet every two weeks in Colorado, in Montecristi canton.  This area is noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is where Deice lives.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are already adults.  Her youngest is 17 years old and in high school.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a driver and owns a bus.

Deice is a housewife.  In order to make her own money she sells all kinds of clothing.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from home where her customers come to buy her goods.  She works every day, mainly in the mornings.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and also receives some from Colombia.  She has been in this business for 14 years and started out with her first loan from the institution.

Deice will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing so that she can make the most of the Christmas and New Year season.  Deice is a founding member of her community bank and likes it because the interest rates are lower than they are with other loan institutions.

Deice's dream is to see her son become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja pues sufrió un accidente.

Doña Carmen  para poder salir adelante con su familia instalo un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, bocadillos y otras golosinas, este negocio lo puso para aprovechar que su casa está frente a un colegio y por lo general los chicos gustan de todos estos productos por lo cual las ventas están aseguradas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00, que es hasta cuando hay movimiento por la salida de los estudiantes. Gracias a los créditos que recibió de la institución ella pudo financiar este pequeño negocio que le ayuda mucho para su sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar dulces, golosinas, helados entre otras cosas que también vende. Está en el banco comunal hace cuatro años y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The 'De Colorado' community bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, in Montecristi canton.  This area is noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and also for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is where Carmen lives.  She is 55 years old, married, and has six children who are all adults.  Four of her children still live with her.  Her husband no longer works as he suffered an accident.

In order to provide for her family, Carmen set up a small bar in her home where she sells iced treats, colas, snacks and candies.  She set up her business as her house is located opposite a school and the kids love all these products.  This means that her sales are guaranteed.  Carmen works every day from 6.00am to 6.00pm which is when the school kids are about.  Thanks to the loans that she has received from the institution, she has been able to finance her small business which helps her so much in providing for her family's daily needs.

Carmen will use this loan to buy sweet treats, candies, iced treats and other products that she sells.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and likes it because of the help and support she receives from the bank.

Carmen's dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats, candies, iced treats, etc.

loans.name: Holaya Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Holaya, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es mayor de edad y que está comprometido, pero  aun vive con ella junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Su esposo es agricultor pero ya no labora por la edad.

Doña Holaya  es la encargada del bar de una escuela de localidad donde ella habita, allí  vende todo tipo de producto preparados en casa y de fabrica, ella prepara y vende corviches, empanadas, jugos de frutas, además de golosinas, sodas, gelatinas entre otras cosas, además hace poco con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres la cual junto a su marido administran, trabaja de lunes a viernes en el bar de la escuela y esto lo lleva  realizando  por más de diez años y su tienda recién tiene un año pero que de a poco la está surtiendo con la ayuda de los créditos.

Este crédito es para comprar  los víveres necesarios para preparar los bocadillos que vende en su bar. Lleva más de 8  años en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella comenzó con su tienda.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Colorado meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture. Its local arts are recognized at the national and international levels. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

Ms. Holaya lives in this city. She is 64 years old, is married, and has an adult son from her marriage. Although her son is engaged, he lives with Ms. Holaya, her husband, and her younger son. Her husband is a farmer, but does not work anymore due to his age.

Doña Holaya is in charge of the bar of a local school in the neighborhood where she lives. There, she sells all kinds of commercially prepared and homemade products. She prepares and sells corviches (an Ecuadorian dish made of green bananas and fish), empanadas, fruit juices, candies, sodas, and gelatins, among other things. With one of the previous loans she has received from the bank, she and her husband stocked a small grocery shop that they run together. She works Monday through Friday in the school bar, and has been doing this for more than 10 years. She has had her shop for one year, but has been stocking it little by little with help from loans.

This loan will be used to purchase the necessary supplies to prepare bocadillos (sandwiches)that she will sell in her bar.  Doña Holaya has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years, and likes it because she has been able to begin her store with loan money.

Her dream is to continue to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yinger Marilin

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Yinger, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 6 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.

Doña Yinger como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz en su casa lugar en el cual ella también vende ciertos repuestos, lubricantes, líquidos de frenos entre otras cosas, ella aprovecha para venderles a los clientes que a diario asisten al taller de su esposo el cual es muy concurrido ya que su marido tiene mucha experiencia arreglando automotores, él lleva más de 17 años con el taller el cual es la forma de como se gana la vida y el sustento de la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar ciertas herramientas, lubricantes y repuestos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar a su marido.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local de venta de repuestos.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Colorado meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and crafts, which are recognized at the national and international levels. It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

Ms. Yinger lives in this city. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children--ages 15, 12, and 6 years old. The older children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Like a good wife, Doña Yinger is applying for this loan for her husband to use in his work. He has an auto mechanic shop in their home, where he and Yinger sell spare/replacement parts, lubricants, and brake fluid among other items. She would like to take advantage of this opportunity to sell to the regular customers that visit her husband's shop. Her husband has a lot of experience repairing cars, and has had the auto repair shop for more than 17 years. It is the way in which he earns a living and supports his family.

This loan is to buy tools, lubricants, and spare/replacement parts. Doña Yinger has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years, and she likes it because she can help her husband.

Her dream is to have a large shop to sell spare and replacement parts.

loans.use: to buy tools, lubricant, and spare/replacement parts.

loans.name: Bettsy Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Bettsy, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos ya mayores de edad y la menor de de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Doña Bettsy es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas y productos de Lebel, Esika y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4 años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva más de 7 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Colorado" meets every 15 days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi.  This is a place that is known at the national and international level for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts.  This is where the famous "Panama" straw hats are made.

This is the home of Bettsy, 45, who is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are grown, and the youngest, who is 15 years old, is in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Bettsy is a housewife who, in order to generate her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses, has a business selling women's undergarments and beauty products from the Lebel, Esika, and Saysun brands (cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works 3 days a week, for 2 to 3 hours a day.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  Bettsy has had this business for more than 4 years, and it is doing very well.

Bettsy will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and women's underwear.  She has been with her communal bank for more than 7 years, and she likes it because the payments on the loans are easy to make.

Bettsy's dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Jessica Jessenia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad el cual es su vida entera. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
 
Doña Jessica tiene una tienda de víveres su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, ella además también vende zapatos por catalogo de varias marcas lo cual le deja ganancias extras, estas ventas las realiza puerta a puerta aunque también enseña sus revistas a las clientes que llegan hasta su negocio y es allí donde más ventas realiza. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para su tienda y zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos urgentes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio el mismo que hoy le permite ganarse la vida.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Colorado" meets every 15 days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi. This is a place that is known at the national and international level for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts. This is where the famous "Panama" straw hats are made.

This is where Jessica, age 20, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced a 3 year-old child, who is her whole life.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Jessica has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, vegetables, and fruit.  She also sells a variety of brands of shoes from catalogs, which gives her some extra earnings.  She makes these sales door-to-door, and she also shows her catalogs to the customers who visit her store, and this is where she makes most of her sales.  She's had this catalog business for 2 years now, and it is going very well.

Jessica will use this loan to buy groceries for her store and shoes, because she has some urgent orders to fill.  She has been with her communal bank for 3 years, and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans, and this business is how she currently makes a living.

Jessica's goals are to continue forward with her business, and gradually expand her store over time.

loans.use: to buy groceries and shoes

loans.name: Ariunjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunjargal, 30 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Since 2006, he has been rendering a taxi service to local people. His wife teaches at a private university and recently began her doctorate degree. Their daughter, 5 years old, goes to elementary school and is currently in 1st grade. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, the family is in urgent need of house improvements including interior repair and building a new hearth. So, he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy construction materials and bricks, which will be used for building a new hearth. As a result, their little girl can live in a comfortable place and the new hearth will heat the house to its fullest.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for interior house repair and building a new hearth.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Ms Safina is 38 years old and married. She is a young, active mother of two kids. She has been running a beauty parlor for three years. She is eager to support her family because her husband's income is not enough to meet her expenses. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. To get more hair products, treatments, skin products, and make-up kits, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. She wants to get more customers. She dreams to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Ngayma Dioula's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été crée le 07 Février 2001. Il est composé de 20 membres qui vivent en bonne entente et développent une bonne solidarité de groupe.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Fama est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 4 garçons et 03 filles.
Le prêt reçu  lui permet de continuer son  activité commerciale, la vente de légumes. Elle achète 45 kg de carottes à raison de 400f le kg pour revendre à 600f, 04 sacs de choux,le sac à 12500f ce qui lui revient à 18000f, 02 sacs d'oignons de 20 kg à raison de 7500f le sac pour le revendre à 8000f, 03 sacs de patate de 40kg à 11000f, qu'elle revende à 16000f.
Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes et d'investir.
texts.en:
This group is part of a Banc Villageois created on February 7, 2001.  It is made up of 20 members who get along well and strongly support each other as a group.

Fama, age 49, is standing on the right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand.  She is married and the mother of seven children (four boys and three girls).

The loan she received allows her to continue her vegetable business and to buy:

- 45 kg of carrots at a price of 400 francs per kilo (resale price: 600 francs per kilo),
- four bags of cabbage at a price of 12,500 francs per bag (resale price: 18,000 francs),
- two twenty-kilo bags of onions at a price of 7,500 francs per bag (resale price: 8,000 francs),
- three 40-kilo bags of potatoes at a price of 11,000 francs (resale price: 16,000 francs).

Profits will be reinvested and used to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy 45 kg of carrots, 4 bags of cabbage, 2 twenty-kilo bags of onions and 3 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce BV est crée le 16 avril 2010. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent dans le même village et qui font comme activité principale le commerce. 
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Dial, âgée de 48 ans est mariée et mère d'un  garçon et de 2 filles. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce.
Le prêt reçu lui permet d'acheter 2 à 3 sacs d'arachide, qu'elle va stocker et au moment opportun elle va vendre pour acheter 3 moutons.
Avec les bénéfices générés, elle compte terminer la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" is created on April 16, 2010. It consists of women who live in the same village and whose main business is shopkeeping. Standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, Dial is 48 years old and is married and mother to one boy and 2 girls. Her main business is shopkeeping.

The loan received allows her to buy 2 to 3 bags of groundnuts, which she will stock and sell at a convenient time to buy 3 sheep. With the profits generated, she plans to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois a été crée le 15 octobre 2010. Il est composé de 47 membres qui vivent une parfaite entente. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce.
Yandé debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 60nas. Elle est veuve et mère de 2 garçon et 1 fille. Elle exerce comme activité principale le commerce.
