En effet avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 1 panier de poisson fumé à 50 000f et 100kg de mil.
Les bénéfices générés lui serviront à renforcer ses épargnes  et à acheter du riz pour préparer la période hivernale.
texts.en:
The village lending group (Banc Villageois) was created October 15, 2010. It is made up of 47 members who live in perfect understanding of one another. As their main business, they all work in trade.
Yandé, standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 60 years old. She is a widow and mother of two boys and one girl. As her main activity, she works in trade. 
In effect, with the loan received, she is going to buy one basket of fish, costing 50,000XOF, and 100kg of millet.
She will use the profits generated to reinforce her savings and to buy rice to prepare for winter.

loans.use: to buy millet and a basket of smoked fish.

loans.name: Malick's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été crée le 07 Février 2001. Les membres qui le composent ont une bonne entente et une solidarité de groupe. 
Marame, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 6 enfants dont 04 garçons et 2 filles. 
Elle fait comme activité l'embouche ovine, avec le prêt elle va acheter 4 sujets, l'un à 25000f. Concernant l'engraissement du bétail, elle achète de l'aliment et gère aussi les frais vétérinaires. Au de bout de 5 mois quand elle va revendre elle avoir l'un à 35 000f.
Les bénéfices générés servent à acheter un autre sujet qu'elle va garde pour elle même. Elle pourra aussi renforcer ses épargnes avec les bénéfices.
texts.en:
This village bank was formed on February 7th, 2001.  The members get along well together and are supportive of each other.

Marame, stood on the right of the photo raising her hand, is 60 years old.  She is married and has six children: four sons and two daughters.

Marame's business is fattening sheep.  With this loan, she will buy four sheep at 25,000 francs each.  She will also buy animal feed and pay vet fees.  At the end of five months, she will re-sell the sheep for 35,000 francs each.

The profits Marame makes will allow her to buy another sheep which she will keep for herself.  She will also be able to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep and animal feed

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée le 07 Février 2001. Les membres qui le composent ont une bonne entente et une solidarité de groupe. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main la vedette Aîssata est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va faire de l'embouche ovine et s'approvisionne au marché de sa localité. Elle achète 06 moutons à raison de 30 000 frs l'un qu'elle engraisse pendant 05 mois pour revendre à 65 000 frs l'unité. La charge globale ( nourriture et vaccins ) s'élève à 60 000 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en nourriture.
texts.en:
This village lending group (banc villageois) was created on February 7, 2001. The members that make it up have a good understanding of one another and group solidarity.

Standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, the featured borrower Aîssata is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of five children: two boys and three girls.

With her loan, she is going to practice sheep fattening and stocks up at a local market. She buys six sheep for 30,000XOF each, which she fattens over five months to resell for 65,000XOF each. The overall cost (food and vaccinations) is up to 60,000XOF.

The profits generated by this business allow her to improve the conditions of her family's life in terms of nutrition.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Mbamba a été crée le 23 Mai 2002. Il est composé de femmes ayant une bonne solidarité de groupe et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main la vedette Fatou est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte acheter 03 moutons à 35 000 frs l'unité qu'elle élève pendant un certain temps pour revendre à 60 000 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent de renforcer son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The Mbamba banc villageois was created on May 23, 2002. It is composed of women who have a strong relationship with each other and who all engage in small-scale commerce. Standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised is Fatou, the featured borrower of this group. 

Fatou is 44 years old, married, and a mother of three boys. 

With this loan, she intends to buy three sheep at 35,000 francs each. She will rear these sheep for a certain amount of time and then resell them for 60,000 francs [each].

The profits from these sales will allow her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy three sheep to rear and resell

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 23 Mai 2002. Il est composé de femmes solidaires entre elles et exerçant toutes la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Ngabou est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 filles et 01 garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte acheter du mil pour 200 kgs à 175 frs le kg et de l'arachide pour 300 kgs à 225 frs le kg. 
Elle va revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires à 185 frs le kg de mil et 235 frs le kg d'arachide. 

Avec les bénéfices elle paie ses intérêts, renforce ses épargnes et assure les charges scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group was created on May 23, 2002. It is made up of women with solidarity amongst themselves and all working in the same area, which is small business.
Standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, the featured borrower Ngabou is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of six girls and one boy.
With the loan, she counts on buying 200 kgs of millet at 175XOF/kg, and 300g of ground nuts at 225XOF/kg.
She is going to resell in the weekly markets at a rate of 185XOF/kg for millet and 235kg for groundnuts.
With the profits, she will pay her interest, reinforce her savings, and provide for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and millet to resell.

loans.name: Ndembane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois est âgé de 14 ans. Les membres qui le composent, travaillent en parfaite collaboration. Leur principale activité est le commerce et l'embouche. 
Tening debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont une fille et 6 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire de l'embouche et du commerce avec le prêt. Elle va acheter 10 moutons, l'un à 20 000f, 400kg de mil dont 200f le kg, 100kg de niébé le kg à 550 et 200kg d'arachide le kg à 235f. le reste du prêt elle donne ça à son fils qui gère une boutique.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de renforcer la boutique de son fils et de  prendre en charge pour les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This village lending group (banc villageois) is fourteen years old. The members that make it up work in perfect collaboration. Their main activities are trade and livestock fattening.
Standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, the featured borrower is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children (one girl and six boys).
She plans to do livestock fattening and business with the loan. She is going to buy 10 sheep for 20,000XOF each, 400kg of millet at 200XOF/kg, 100kg of cowpeas at 500XOF/kg, and 200kg of groundnuts at 235XOF/kg. She will give the rest of the loan to her son, who runs a store.
The profits realized will allow her to strengthen her son's store and to take care of her children's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep, 400kg of millet, 200kg of groundnuts, and 100kg of cowpeas.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est âgé de 14 ans. Les membres qui le composent, travaillent en parfaite collaboration. Leur principale activité est le commerce et l'embouche. Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons et 3 filles.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 15 moutons dont l'unité à 20 000f, pour engraisser vite et bien les sujets elle achète des aliments de bétail, afin de vendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois à 50000f l'un.
Les bénéfices lui servent à prendre en charge ses frais médicaux et celui de ses enfants et petits enfants. Elle gère par moment aussi la dépense quotidienne et les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group is 14 years old. The members that make it up work in perfect collaboration. Their main business is trade and livestock fattening. Amy, standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 66 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children (four boys and three girls). 
With the loan, she is going to buy 15 sheep for 20,000XOF each. To fatten them quickly and efficiently, she is buying livestock feed in order to sell them for 50,000XOF each after four to five months.
She will use the profits to take care of her medical expenses and those of her children and grandchildren. At times she also manages the daily spending and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and livestock food

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est âgé de 14 ans. Les membres qui le composent, travaillent en parfaite collaboration. Leur principale activité est le commerce et l'embouche.
Astou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 6 garçons et 3 filles.
Elle fait du commerce en vendant de la crème glacée. Elle achète du pain de singe, des produits comme du sucre, de la vanille,des arômes et des sachets pour congeler la crème.
Avec les bénéfices générés, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne, assure les frais médicaux des enfants en cas de maladie. Elle gère aussi les fournitures des enfants, paye ses intérêts et augmente ses épargnes dans le BV.
texts.en:
This group was formed 14 years ago.  Its members work in perfect harmony together.  Their main business activities are sales and animal raising.  

Astou, who is stood on the right of the photo raising her hand, is 48 years old.  She is married and the mother of nine children: six sons and three daughters.

Astou's business is selling ice cream.  She will use her loan to buy baobab tree fruit, products such as sugar, vanilla and flavorings, and bags in which to freeze the ice cream.

With the profits she makes, Astou contributes toward her family's daily expenses and covers her children's medical expenses in case they are sick.  She also provides her children with supplies, makes her interest payments, and increases her savings with her village bank.

loans.use: to buy baobab tree fruit and products she needs for making cream (sugar, flavorings..)

loans.name: Ami's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 23 Mai 2002. Il est composé de femmes habitant la même zone et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant  la main, la vedette Amy est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons et 03 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 02 barriques d'arachide à 25 000 frs l'unité et 05 barriques de mil à 15 000 frs l'unité. Elle revend le mil à 20 000 frs la barrique de mil et 26 000 frs celle de l'arachide. 

Avec les bénéfices générés elle va payer ses intérêts, renforcer ses épargnes et améliorer les besoins de sa famille surtout ceux de ses enfants par la prise en charge de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 23, 2002. It consists of women living in the same zone and practicing the same business which is shop keeping.

Standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, the featured borrower Amy is 42 years old. She is married and mother to 2 boys and 3 girls.

With the loan received, she is going to buy 2 barrels of groundnuts at 25,000 frs each and 5 barrels of mil [African cereal] at 15,000 frs each. She resells the mil at 20,000 frs per barrel of mil and 26,000 frs per barrel of groundnuts.

With the profits generated she is going to pay the interest, strengthen her savings and improve the needs of her family especially those of her children by taking care of their schooling.

loans.use: to buy mil [African cereal] and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Veronique's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est âgé de 14 ans. Les membres qui le composent, travaillent en parfaite collaboration. Leur principale activité est le commerce et l'embouche.
Khemesse, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est veuve; mère de 08 enfants dont 05 garçons. Elle a en charge aussi 10 petits enfants.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte faire de l'embouche ovine, elle achète les sujets et les engraisse et au bout de 5 mois elle les revend.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettent  de gérer la dépense quotidienne, lorsque ses petits enfants tombent malades j'assure leurs frais médicaux. J'appuie aussi mes enfants à payer les frais de scolarité de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group has been together for 14 years and its members work very well together. Their main business is the fattening and selling [of animals]. 

Khemesse, standing on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is 65 years old. She is a widow and a mother of eight children, five boys and three girls. She also supports ten grandchildren. 

With this loan, she hopes to buy some sheep and then fatten them up. After about five months, she will resell them. 

The profits from this will allow her to manage her living expenses. And when her grandchildren get sick, she can take care of the medical costs. She also supports her grandchildren by paying for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Touba Cadior Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est inauguré le 12/5/2010.C'est un groupe constitué de 21 femmes en bonne entente. Elles habitent toutes la même localité.

L'emprunteur en vedette de ce groupe, Ndeytou, est une femme mariée de 35 ans avec 03 enfants dont un garçon. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle gère aussi un restaurant au marché. Elle mène ces activités depuis plus de 02 ans. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite vêtue de mauve avec la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter 05 caisses de tomate, 05kg de poivre, 01 caisse d'ail et 03 caisse de bouillon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle rachète des marchandises pour faire tourner son commerce.
texts.en:
This village bank was formed on 12/5/2010.  The group has 21 female members who get along well together and all live in the same town.

The featured borrower for this group is Ndeytou.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her business is selling vegetables.  She also runs a restaurant in the market.  She has been working in these businesses for more than two years.  She is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in purple, with her hand raised.

Ndeytou would like to use this loan to buy 5 crates of tomatoes, 5kg of pepper, 1 crate of garlic and 3 crates of stock (broth).

With the profits she makes, Ndeytou buys more merchandise so that she can keep her business running.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as fresh tomatoes, peppers, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Thiokhna Sagatta Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe est inauguré le 12/5/2010. Il est constitué de 04 femmes en bonne entente. Elles habitent toutes la même localité.

Madame Coumba l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 31 ans mariée sans enfant. Elle est couturière et posséde une boutique de produits cosmétiques; sur la photo elle est de debout à droite portant une robe bleue et a levé la main gauche. 

Elle achéte ses marchandises tissus parfums crème de beauté.....à Touba et Dakar elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans.

Son prêt sera destiné à acheter des tissus pour 75000 F, des produits cosmétiques pour une valeur de 125000 F et de l'arachide pour 200000 F. Elle souhaite à l'avenir acheter une parcelle pour construire une maison et un atelier de couture afin de bien mener ses activités.
texts.en:
This village bank was formed on 12/5/2010.  It has four female members who get along well together and all live in the same town.

Coumba is the featured borrower for this group.  She is 31 years old, married, and doesn't have any children.  She is a seamstress and also owns a cosmetics store.  She is standing on the far right of the photo, wearing a blue dress and raising her left hand.

Coumba buys her fabric, perfumes and beauty creams in Touba and Dakar.  She has been in this line of work for 10 years.

Coumba will use her loan to buy fabric for 75,000 francs, cosmetics for 125,000 francs and groundnuts for 200,000 francs.  She hopes, in the future, to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house and a sewing workshop so that she can run her business well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ndoumbe's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé par les femmes qui habitent dans le même village et des alentours. Elles font comme activité principale le petit commerce. Coumba âgée de 55 ans est mariée et a la charge de 7 enfants. Elle est debout à droite de la photo et levant la main. Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage de faire du commerce avec la transformation de jus de fruit pour revendre au marché de sa localité tous les mercredis. Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de soutenir ses belles filles dans la dépense quotidienne et renforcer ses épargnes
texts.en: This group is created since May 12, 2010. It consists of women who live in the same village and its surroundings. Their main business is shopkeeping. Coumba is 55 years old and is married and responsible for 7 children. She is standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand. With the loan received she envisions selling processed fruit juice to resell it at the market of her locale every Wednesday. The profits generated allow her to support her beautiful daughters with the daily expenses and strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baobab fruit and sorrel to make natural juice.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is single but has one child. She has received schooling through to junior high school. 

Gifty operates a beauty salon at Akpafu, Hohoe. She has done this job for the past 7 years. Gifty uses her income to pay for her only child's upbringing and cater to her younger siblings. 

Gifty will use the loan to purchase hair relaxers, pomade, hair spray, and more rollers, since her customers have increased. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty intended to introduce the selling of cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, pomade, hair spray, and more rollers.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Ms Asia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Asia's husband. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of six children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity she applied for a loan of 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Asia dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, packs of polish, and nails in larger quantity

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a widow and has 5 children. She operates a grocery shop at Wiomoa near Abura , which she has done for 5 years. Comfort uses her income to pay her children's school fees and other expenses of the home. Comfort will use the loan to purchase a variety of groceries like tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc. to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries like tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has 2 children.  Araba sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) and fried fish in Brenu Akyimu near Elmina. She has been in this business for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income to help pay for her grand-children's school fees. Araba will use the loan to purchase maize and fish in bulk for the preparation of the kenkey in larger quantities for sale.

With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase maize and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Flor Del Valle Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VALLE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, decoración de flores, venta de ropa, venta de panza, carnicería, venta de pan, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, negocio lo implemento de un negocio anterior en el que trabajaba de empleada.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vajillas) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio e comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su sustento.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Valle” communal bank is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Pamela serves as the secretary.  The members have various businesses, including fish sales, floral decorations, clothing sales, bread sales, butcher shop, and food sales.
 
The loan will benefit the small businesses, including Pamela’s.  She is in her first cycle with Pro Mujer and joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has a food business and started it after working as an employee for another business.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy dishes from stores who sell in quantity and then will set them up in her business space.  This work allows her to generate income to earn a living.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and financing.

loans.use: to buy dishes.

loans.name: Al-Amal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Amal which consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Collectively, they took out a loan of YER 200,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Fatima is the leader of this group. She is a 39-year-old, married woman with three children. Fatima is a correspondent in the media. She has worked in this field for many years. She has a small amount to buy home furnishings, but it is not enough. 

Fatima applied for a loan of YER 40,000 from AMB to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Al-Fol Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Fol and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Samira is 33 years old, a married woman who has six children. She is a tailor who has been operating this business for two years. She took many courses in her field till she was able to be professional in her business. She works hard to finish her clients' requirements. She said this business is not extremely profitable, so she intends to enlarge her business. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Al_Ahsan Group

texts.en: This group, which is called Al_Ahsan, consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Sahar is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Her educational background is a bachelor's degree. She has applied for a loan of 80000 YER, as part of the group loan from AMB, to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Al-Amal Total Group

texts.en: This group is callled Al-Amal Total and consists of five men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. All of them work in Total Company. Redwan is 40 years old and has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine to use for his house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to use for his house.

loans.name: Fatehy

texts.en: Fatehy is a 34-year-old married man and lives in Sana`a,Yemen. He has had an electronics shop for a long period. He translated his experience from starting working with his father where he and his family live. He gained experience when he worked with his father. He has earned a profit and he hopes to continue expanding his working capital, which is often insufficient to meet the demand of his clients. This is exactly the reason he has come to AMB, requesting a loan of 150,000 YER. He will use it to buy electronics.

loans.use: to buy electronics for his business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. After accomplishing her Bachelors Degree, she decided to engage in business to generate income. With a small amount of capital, she buys some dry goods and footwear that she sells in the local community. She has been in this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of only PHP 6,000 a month, that she utilizes for their daily necessities. Due to the hardships of living, she aims to improve the business to supplement her husband's income and to save for the future of their children. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy more dry goods like jackets, pants, T-shirts, shorts, underwear, shoes and slippers to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like jackets, pants, T-shirts, shorts, underwear, shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Ms. Sidra is 22 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. For the past five years, Sidra has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has eight buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. Her husband is happy with the business of Sidra. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She has been in association with Kashf for three years. She wishes to spend part of the revenues on the betterment of her family members. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is now 30 years old and still single. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. As a way of gaining income, she runs a small variety store in the local community, selling different grocery items. 

She planned to improve the business in order to generate a higher income to support the education of her younger sisters and to save some for her future. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional 10,000.00 Philippines pesos to buy mineral water, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and beverages for sale. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to make an improvement in the business, and she is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral water, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 31 years old and a dedicated mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Shehnaz's husband. Her husband runs a donkey cart as a transportation service. Two years ago he started this business with a single donkey cart. The donkeys help customers carry material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs.
 
In order to purchase larger wooden cart for the donkey, Shehnaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. This way her husband will be able to take more things on his cart at once, like fruits and vegetables. This ultimately saves his time and hopefully will increase his net income. Shehnaz plans to spend the additional revenue on bettering the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger wooden donkey cart.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Alice aims to improve her small variety store and increase her income to continue sending her children to school. With her husband, she agreed to educate their children and give them a better life. For this reason, Alice is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional hair clips, pony tails, coin purses, toys, cotton buds, lighters, batteries and school supplies to sell. Being an industrious mother, she believes the business will grow and becomes more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional hair clips, pony tails, coin purses, toys, cotton buds, lighters, batteries and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 42 years of age, married, and has five children. He's been a farmer for six years and has been raising rice crops on his two hectares of rice field. Each growing season, he make sure that his farm plot is well prepared, containing nutrients to ensure the proper growth of his crop.

Carlito would like to maintain his good crop production so he can meet the family's daily needs and let his three children finish their studies. Carlito approaches life with determination. He is asking for additional capital so he can provide all the necessary farm supplies needed in his farming business. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be use to buy certified seed and fertilizer. He hopes to obtain his requested loan amount so he can reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and fertilizer for his rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 44 years old and a hard-working mother who sells dry goods in the local community. She aims to improve the family's status of living, especially educating her child to give him a bright future. 

To achieve her goals, Loreta plans to increase her product offerings so she can better satisfy her customers' demand. She has been operating the business for more than 10 years and usually earns a profits of 8,000 PHP per month, which support the family's daily needs and her child's school fees. 

Since she has inadequate capital to increase product offerings, Loreta is asking for an additional 25,000 PHP to buy more dry goods like shorts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and shoes. Through this financial assistance, she is hoping that she will become successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like shorts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and shoes.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms. Shazia is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking lady running a business of milk sales for 12 years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family while her husband also does milk work and is employed in a mill. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She is a mother of seven children; five of them are school-going. 

Ms. Shazia has some savings and has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for two years. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk sales. She has 2 cows and 1 buffalo in milk. In the beginning, she used to purchase goats and sheep and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha, gradually she purchased cows and buffaloes to initiate the business of selling milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She counts a good client list. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life.

She is a mother of three children. Her husband also helps in her business, while her husband is also related with agriculture. Ms. Nasreen is in her second loan cycle and has strong association with Kasf foundation. Now she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more cow to increase production capacity of milk. In this way she would be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to utilize part of revenue on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase production capacity of milk.

loans.name: Ramad Al-Hob Group

texts.en: This group is called Ramad Al-Hob which consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Hossn is a 52-year-old, married woman who lives in Taiz. She is a cleaner who applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, age 59, plants and harvests rice and vegetables. She also raises livestock to offer for sale. She and her husband have brought up eight children, and they want to improve their poor living conditions in order to help give their children a brighter future. 

Due to her financial constraints, Francisca engages in buying and selling cull in the community in order to generate additional income. She hopes to improve this business to increase her income. She is therefore requesting additional capital of PhP 10,000.00 to buy more stocks of cull to offer for sale in  her community. 

She is confident that she can improve the business and make it a more viable source of income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cull to offer for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widow having two children. She works hard in order to earn a living. It's been nine years since her husband died due to stroke. Josephine's situation pushes her to strive hard for her family's welfare.

Josephine inherited her one hectare of farmland from her parents. She is really grateful because she can manage her farming business smoothly. Since she's the only breadwinner of the family, Josephine is in need of additional capital amounting to 20,000 PHP which will be use to buy fertilizer and for payment of hired laborers who will perform some farming activities. She hopes that she could get this loan amount so she can produce better yields which enables her to attain her goal in life and so with her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor cost of transplanting her farmland

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms. Sharifan has been running a business of milk sales for the past ten years. She is a mother of three children; one of her children is shown in the photo.  

Sharifan initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and two cows. 

This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her two sons to school for studies. 

Sharifan has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is now 35 years old and single. He aims to become financially stable and have a bright future. To achieve his goals, he cultivates his farm land by planting different varieties of vegetables that he sells in the local community. He wants to increase his production and income to satisfy his necessities, support the education of his younger brothers and save for his future. In this regard, he plans to expand his plantation to ensure a high production. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy foliar fertilizer and insecticides needed to sustain his vegetable production. He his hoping that this financial assistance will help him improve his farming business and that he will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Abu Al-Fadl

texts.en:
Abu Al-Fadl is 37 years old, married and the father of seven children, most of whom are in primary school. 

Abu Al-Fadl is a food distributor to small groceries. He purchases food and other simple goods from big producers and distributes to small groceries in Sana'a, using a tricycle to carry goods. He is a hardworking man. 

He applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy more goods to cover the demand of his clients/groceries. This loan is the second loan which will be funded by Kiva. Abu Al-Fadl thanks Kiva for financing him in the first loan because he made more profit and he intends to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase goods from producers to distribute to small groceries.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 42-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years. She has 3 cows and 1 buffalo to milk. When she first started working with livestock, she used to purchase goats and sheep and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha. Gradually Rasheedan purchased cows and buffaloes so she could move from livestock sales into milk production. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk, and she is proud to maintain a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

Rasheedan is a mother of four: two daughter and two sons. Her husband also helps in her business. She has already been a borrower previously and has a strong relationship with Kashf foundation, Kiva's field partner. Now she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR so she can buy one more cow and increase her milk production capacity. This would allow her to serve more people in her community.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for milk production.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is 56 years old, married, and lives in Aden, Yemen. He has 3 adult children. He applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB, Kiva's field partner, to buy bedroom materials for his home.

loans.use: to buy bedroom materials for his home.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 32-year-old, married woman doing a business of milk sales. She has two cows that provide milk. 

In the beginning, Yasmeen used to purchase calves and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event). Gradually, she purchased cows and buffalos to initiate the business of selling milk.  She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese, and ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. Her business is good enough to help lead a decent life.

Yasmeen is a mother of five children. Her husband helps with her business. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 20000 to buy one more cow to increase the production capacity of milk and increase her sales. In this way, Yasmeen would be able to serve more people in her community, which ultimately helps in bringing home more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow, to increase the production capacity of milk and increase her sales.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Ms. Saima is a 36-year-old married woman who does hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy spools of thread in different colors and packets of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her products. In this way, she will be able to serve more customers in a consistent way. She is hoping to increase her income by targeting more customers. Saima dreams of a bright future for her children, and she is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packets of beads, sequins and stones for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is 40 years old. He is a married man and has four children who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a doctor who treats his patients well. He said he offers for his patients a humanitarian service. 

He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy construction supplies like cement, sand, etc., for his home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies like cement, sand, etc., for his home.

loans.name: Majambere Group

texts.fr:
Georgette fait partie du groupe Majambere  et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a  25 ans et est mariée à  Arthémon, un commerçant de chaussures.  Ensemble, Ils ont  2  jeunes enfants .

Elle fait le commerce de chaussures   depuis 1 an. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de chaussures  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Georgette belongs to the Majambere group and lives in Gitega.  She is 25 years old and married to Arthémon, a shoe salesman.  The couple have two young children.

Georgette has been selling shoes for one year.

This is Georgette's first loan from Turame.  With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of shoes to re-sell so that she can earn more money.

In the not-so-distant future, she would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of shoes to re-sell

loans.name: Allah-Rakhi

texts.en:
Ms. Allah-Rakhi is 52 years old, a vigorous married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is the bread earner, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Allah-Rakhi’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of six children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation, to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She is in her 7th loan cycle. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery.

loans.name: Jak

texts.en:
Jak is fifty-four and married and has three school-aged children; they live in a little town in the northeast part of the country where he operates his appliance repair & servicing, particularly refrigerators and washing machines, from a tiny shop.

Jak has been the only one offering such services for his community for fifteen years, and he claims that he has earned a good income from it. Even though he has been the only one to make an income for his family, thanks to this job, Jak has been able to provide more than the basics for his family. 

He now wants to build appliances from used parts and sell them and to do this; he needs to buy those parts. This is the reason why he is requesting this loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To buy used  parts to build appliances and sell them afterwards

loans.name: Arzoo

texts.en:
Ms. Arzoo has been doing the work of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is very talented and excels in her work. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a bread earner, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Arzoo’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of four children. For the growth of her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf foundation to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Ms. Asia is a 27-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time since her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began hand-embroidery in her home. She started her business to generate some income to support the needs of the family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. In order to complete their orders on time, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20000. This would help her to buy more spools of thread and packets of sequins, threads and pearls in different colors. She is hoping to increase her net income by completing orders on time.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and packets of sequins, threads and pearls in different colors for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 57-year-old, widowed woman. She is the mother of seven children: five daughters and two sons. Her daughters assist Bashiran in her business of stitching gloves. 

Being a single parent, Bashiran is trying hard to fulfill her children's demands, including food, health, and clothing. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

So, Bashiran contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one new stitching machine, with spools of thread. This would help her to inflate her sales, which will ultimately help to generate more net income.

loans.use: to buy one new stitching machine, with spools of thread.

loans.name: Al-Asdqa Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Asdqa, which consists of four men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Nasr is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is an employee of a telecommunications company. He lives in a rented house. His portion of the group's requested loan through AMB is 50,000 YER, which he will use to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to owns a house someday.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Lilian Carminia

texts.es:
La señora Lilian tiene 29 años está casada con el señor Dany,  tienen 2 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, los mismos estudian en el nivel primario. Lilian y su familia son muy unidos y gracias al sacrificio y trabajo de su marido, que tuvo que estar 3 años lejos de su familia, en España,  pudo tener una pequeña casa propia.
Lilian y su familia viven en la comunidad de Mallco Rancho de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su principal actividad es la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de  productos lácteos. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de comederos, porque se aproxima una temporada de lluvia y la señora Lilian desea proteger su ganado construyendo comederos con su respectivo tinglado.
Entre sus sueños y metas está seguir incrementando su ganado hasta tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 30 cabezas y que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional para que de esta manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lilian, 29, is married to Dany.  They have two children in elementary school who depend on their income.  Lilian and her family are very close, and she managed to get a small house of her own thanks to the sacrifice and work of her husband, who had to be far away from the family in Spain for three years.

Lilian and her family live in the community of Mallco Rancho in the city of Cochabamba.  Her main activity is producing raw milk, which she sells to a dairy-product business.  Her loan is to build troughs because the rainy season is approaching and Lilian wants to protect her cattle by building troughs with a shed.

Among her dreams and goals are continuing to increase her cattle until she has a small farm of at least 30 head and for her children to be able to study for a profession so they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build troughs

loans.name: Mzekala

texts.en:
Mzekala, age 21, is engaged in a family agricultural business in a small village of the Tskalbuto district. She lives with her husband, two infant children, her parents-in-law, and her brother-in-law. They have five milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production, and at present they also have four calves. In addition, they have a pig and they sell piglets. The family also grows greens and cucumbers on their available farm land. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. 

Mzekala is a very hard-working woman and has gained a great deal of experience in her business. She has requested a loan in order to build a greenhouse. With a functioning greenhouse, Mzekala will be able to grow different kinds of vegetables and sell them at market for good prices. This will increase the income of the family, thus raising their standard of living.

Mzekala is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
¡Hola desde, Perú! La Sra. Kharym tiene 26 años, se caracteriza por ser una mujer fuerte, aguerrida y muy emprendedora. Kharym pertenece al GRUPO MARIA ELENA MOYANO, el cual está conformado por 6 personas. La Sra. Kharym tiene 1 hijo y es por este motivo que lucha día a día para salir adelante. El préstamo solicitado por Kharym es para poder usarlo para la comprar de insumos y abastecer su negocio de Buffets y más en esta temporada navideña donde siempre es propensa a tener una mayor clientela. El grupo MARIA ELENA MOYANO junto a la Sra. Kharym agradecen a KIVA y EDAPROSPO por el préstamo y dicen gracias de corazón a las personas que a través de estas entidades pudieron ayudarlas con sus sueños y metas.
La Sra. Kharym es aquella mujer que viste un polo de color fucsia y se encuentra parada en la parte derecha de la foto.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! 

Kharym is 26 years old, and would class herself as a strong, brave and very enterprising woman. Kharym belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano group, which is made up of 6 people. Kharym has 1 child and it is for this reason that she fights every day to get ahead in life. The loan Kharym is seeking is to buy supplies and to stock her catering business, particularly in this Christmas season when she is always likely to have more customers.

Along with Kharym, the Maria Elena Moyano group is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan, and they thank those people who helped them with their hopes and dreams from the bottom of their heart.

Kharym is the woman dressed in a fuschia-colored T-shirt who is standing on the right-hand side of this photo.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her catering business.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La señora Fermina vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casada  y  tiene dos hijos, quienes están estudiando, desde hace dos años  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de golosinas como ser tajaditas de mínimos, papas fritas, yuca frita, baleadas entre otros, su negocio está abierto todos los días de la semana.
Doña Fermina su  negocio es una pequeña caseta de madera la que se encuentra en  la calle principal de su colonia,  realiza sus compras dos veces a la semana en uno de los  mercados de la ciudad, solicita el crédito para la compra de mínimos, papas, manteca, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, huevos, soda, sal y yuca, que son la materia prima para la preparación de las golosinas,.
Doña Fermina su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder acondicionarlo más grande.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Fermina lives in Tegucigalpa.  She’s married, has two children who attend school, and has been making and selling snacks such as mínimos wedges, fried potatoes, fried yucca, baleadas (Honduran flour tortillas with beans and cheese), among other things.  Her business is open every day of the week.

Fermina’s business is in a small kiosk located on a small main street.  She makes her purchases twice a week in one of the city markets and is asking for this loan in order to buy mínimos, potatoes, cheese, butter, eggs, soda, salt, and yucca to make her snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene dos hijos los cuales depende solo de ella ya que su esposo falleció hace algunos meses, sus hijos están estudiando,hace diez años que ella estudio corte y confección de ropa, por lo que inicio ofreciéndole sus servicios a las amigas, desde entonces ya cuenta con clientas fijas y vecino que les hace reparaciones a sus prendas.
Doña Martha gracias a  su negocio y con el apoyo de su esposo construyo varios cuartos los cuales le sirven como otros ingresos ya que los alquila, es muy amable y carismática en su colonia es muy conocida.  
Doña Martha solicita el préstamo para la compra de cemento, varillas, arena y ladrillos materiales que ocupa para la  construcción de una pared en la parte interna de su casa, actualmente se encuentra de madera y su sueño es verla terminada y muy bonita.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Martha lives in Tegucigalpa and has two children who depend on her.  Her husband passed away a few months ago, so she is the sole provider.  Her children attend school.  She studied clothes making ten years ago and she started providing services to her friends.  Since then, she has had steady customers and neighbors who bring their clothing in for repair.

Martha, thanks to her business and her husband’s encouragement, built various rooms which generate other income because she rents them out.  She is very friendly, charismatic, and well known in her neighborhood.

Martha is asking for this loan in order to buy cement, rods, sand, and bricks which she will use to build a wall in the inside part of her house.  It’s currently made out of wood and her dream is to see it nicely finished.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El señor Paulino  tiene 41 años de edad es soltero, sin hijos, estudio hasta nivel secundaria, los escasos recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a continuar sus estudios, actualmente vive con su madre ayudándole en su campo de trabajo ya que ella esta delicada de salud y parte de sus ingresos son para la compra de medicamentos, cuenta con un vehículo Caldina modelo 1997 de color blanco, el cual es la fuente de transporte de él y de su madre como también el transporte y comercialización de sus cultivos. El señor genera ingresos económicos en la producción de naranja y yuca, pero no le es suficiente para el cuidado y el mantenimiento de su cultivo, es por tal motivo que necesita un préstamo para poder incrementar la producción de naranjas esto le ayudará a tener mayores ingresos económicos y paralelamente mejorar su nivel de vida, de él y de su madre.
texts.en: Paulino is 41 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  He has a middle school education because his parents’ limited resources did not allow him to continue.  Now he lives with his mother and helps her with her fields because her health is fragile and he spends part of his income on medicine. He has a white 1997 Caldina (vehicle) which is his and his mother’s source of transportation for the sale of their harvest.  He generates income by raising oranges and yucca, but it’s not enough for the care of his crops, so he needs a loan to be able to increase his orange production.  This will help him financially and also improve his and his mother’s quality of life.

loans.use: to increase his orange production.

loans.name: Sandra Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora  Sandra  vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, vive con su esposo con quien tiene cuatro hijos los cuales se encuentra estudiando en la escuela y colegio públicos de la ciudad,  tiene diez años de dedicarse a la venta de  ropa usada como ser camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa para niños, cada mañana, como su mama vive frente a la calle principal de la colonia donde viven aprovecha para montar una pequeña tienda y poder mostrar a la personas que transitan por el lugar la ropa.
Doña Sandra tiene clientes fijos que siempre le hacen pedidos, ella va una vez a la semana al mercado para comprar la ropa clasificada, en este momento no tiene mucho inventario por la falta de dinero, por lo que está solicitando el apoyo de Prisma para comprar faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzonetas y suéteres, para surtir su negocio en esta temporada navideña  porque tiene bastantes pedidos.
Doña Sandra  su sueño es llegar a tener su propia tienda y vender ropa nueva y sandalias.




Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Sandra lives in Tegucigalpa, with her husband, and four children who attend the public school in the city.  She has been selling second hand clothing, such as shirts, pants, skirts, and children’s clothing for ten years.  Each morning, since her mother lives along a main street in their neighborhood, she sets up a small stand there, where she can show her merchandise to people who pass through.

Sandra has steady customers who always make requests.  She travels to the market once a week to buy clothing but she doesn’t have much inventory at the moment due to lack of capital.  She is asking for a loan to buy skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shirts, socks, and sweaters to stock her business over this Christmas season when she has many requests.

Sandra’s dream is to have her own store and sell new clothing and sandals.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  María, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casada y  tiene una hija pequeña quien se encuentra estudiando, es muy trabajadora y responsable,  hace dos años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Tortillas, su actividad comienza a partir de las 11:00 am y termina a las 9:00 pm,  todos los días de la semana.
Doña María su negocio está ubicado frente a la calle principal de la colonia donde vive, sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por el lugar quienes la prefieren porque sus tortillas son grandes y bonitas, así mismo aprovecha para vender tamalitos de frijoles dos veces por semana y obtener otros ingresos
Doña María está solicitando el apoyo de Prisma para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para comprarla al  por mayor y así obtener precios más bajos.
Doña María su sueño es poder construir una casa para su hija y que ella termina su educación. 



Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Tegucigalpa, is married and the mother of a young, school-age daughter, and is hardworking and responsible. For two years, she has been making and selling tortillas from 11:00 am until 9:00 pm every day. Her business is located on the main road in her neighborhood, and her customers are the people who come through the area. They prefer her tortillas because they are well made and big. She also sells bean tamales twice a week to earn more income.

María is applying to Prisma for a loan to buy corn, wood, and lime at wholesale to receive the lowest prices. Her dream is to build a house and that her daughter finishes her education.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras - November 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de jardin,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de jardin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como colores y plumones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria keeps on running her Kindergarten, working form 8 am to 1 pm. She has been engaging in this activity for 8 years, and things are going very well. She dreams of improving her Kindergarten, and she is requesting a loan to buy items such as colored pencils and markers.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy colored pencils and markers.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de salon de belleza,la socia hace tintes,ondulaciones y cortes de cabellos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de salon de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tintes,tijeras y laciador de cabellos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her beauty salon from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She does dye jobs, perms, and haircuts.  She has been in this business for six years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her beauty salon business.

She's requesting the loan to buy dyes, scissors, and a hair straightener.

She's grateful for the support given to her and is committed to being disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, and a hair straightener

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria,la socia realiza trabajos de camas,armarios y roperos,la socia ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de carpinteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar madera.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Dionicia keeps on working as a carpenter, making beds, cupboards and wardrobes. She has been engaging in this activity for 9 years, and things are going very well. She dreams of expanding her carpentry activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy timber.

She is grateful for the support she is receiving and at the same time she commits to meticulously complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Rocio Alejandra se dedica al trabajo en un jardin,la socia es profesora de niños de 3,4 y 5 años,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,lsa socia ya tiene 5 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales educativos como colores,cuadernos y crayones.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio Alejandra works in a Kindergarten teaching children aged 3, 4 and 5. She works from 8 am to 1 pm, she has already been engaged in this activity for 5 years and things are going very well. Her major wish is to improve in what she does. She is requesting a loan to buy educational items such as colored pencils, notebooks and crayons.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy colored pencils, notebooks and crayons.

loans.name: Vamos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es casada ,tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas como galletas, dulces, chupetines, chocolates entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende en una carreta todos los días durante el dia,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de uno de los parques infantiles de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como galletas, chocolates entre otros para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agencia de viajes, maestro constructor, venta de zapatos, venta de lacteos, venta de comida, artista, venta de turrones, elaboración de tortas, peluquería.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together). This bank is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Juana. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Juana divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling sweets such as cookies, candy, lollipops, chocolates, and other items. She has been in this business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Juana sells every day as a street vendor. She has a cart that is set up at the entrance of one of the children’s parks in the city of Cusco. Juana is a responsible and diligent individual who works in this manner so that she can help her family move forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as cookies, chocolates, and other items for her business.

The other members engage in business activities such as managing a travel agency, working as a master builder, selling shoes, selling dairy products, selling food, producing artwork, making candy, making cakes, and managing a beauty salon. The smaller photo shows the members who requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work reasons.

Juana is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream in this manner, so she is promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolates, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando ak negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia preapara platos como pollo al horno,saltado de carne y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefina keeps on running her restaurant preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She prepares dishes such as roasted chicken, stir-fried steak with potatoes and soups. She works form 8 am to 6 pm and she has been in this line of business for 5 years. She dreams of enlarging the restaurant, and she is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

She is grateful for the support she is receiving and at the same time she commits to meticulously complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia continúa con el trabajo de profesora en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la enseñanza pero también la socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pollos, ella compra pollos pequeños y los hace crecer y engordar y después envía los pollos a  su hija para vender en la ciudad de Pillcopata.

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comida para los pollos como harina de pescado, soya, maíz y vitaminas. Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Julia continues to be a teacher at a High School in the city of Cusco.  She has several years of teaching experience, but she is also a partner at a small business selling chickens.  She buys the chickens when they are little to grow them and fatten them; afterwards, she sends them to her daughter in the city of Pillcopata.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed for the chickens such as fish meal, soy meal, corn and vitamins.  Julia is grateful for this opportunity and commits to complete her loan payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens such as fish meal, soy meal, corn and vitamins.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara pollo al horno,sopas y saltado de carne,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia tiene 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to her restaurant business, where she prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She prepares oven-roasted chicken, soups and beef stew, she works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m., she has seven years of experience and does very well, her dream is to expand the restaurant.  She requests a loan to buy vegetables, chicken and beef.
The member is thankful for the support provided and commits to be disciplined when making the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de administrar un jardin,el socio junto con su esposa trabajan en su jardin de niños,el socio ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,en sus tiempos libres al socio le gusta salira a pasear,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de jardin.El socio solicita el credito para comprar materiales para el jardin como papeles y colores.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teofilo keeps on engaging in his activity, running his Kindergarten, working there with his wife. He has been engaging in this activity for 9 years already and things are going very well. In his free time he likes taking strolls, and he dreams of improving his kindergarten activity. He is requesting a loan to buy items for the Kindergarten such as sheets of paper and colored pencils.

He is grateful for the support he is receiving and at the same time he commits to meticulously complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy sheets of paper and colored pencils.

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia continúa con su negocio de venta de refrigerios. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Elabora hamburguesas, salchipapas, refrescos y entre otros. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la compra de insumos como pollo, carne, aceite, pan, galletas y entre otros.                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha Camila keeps on running her shop, selling light refreshments. She has been engaging in this activity for many years already and things are going very well. She prepares hamburgers, “salchipapas” [fried sausage and French fries] and soft drinks. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, oil, bread and biscuits.
She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, oil, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como docente del nivel primario y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de manualidades de ceramica y telas,la socia se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las manualidades.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tela,agujas,hilos y lanas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa keeps on working as a primary school teacher, as well as carrying out her clay and fabric crafts activity. She runs this activity and things are going very well, and she dreams of owing a locale where to sell her handicrafts. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, needles, threads and wool.

She is grateful for the support she is receiving and at the same time she commits to meticulously complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy fabric, needles, threads and wool.

loans.name: Hector Federico

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,el socio vende faros para carros,retrovisores entre otras autopartes,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes para carros.El socio solicita el credito para comprar faros,retrovisores y aceites.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hector keeps on engaging in his activity, selling car spare parts. He sells headlights and rear-view mirrors for cars among other items. He has been engaging in this activity for 7 years and things are going very well. He dreams of expanding his car spare parts selling activity and he is requesting a loan to buy headlights, rear-view mirrors and car oils.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy headlights, rear-view mirrors and car oils.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella aprendió las labores agrícolas junto a su papá, ella actualmente se dedica a vender perfumenes por catalogo; fue una amiga quien le enseño. Ella aprendió este oficio para ayudar a su compañero de vida con los gastos de la casa. El producto se lo llegan a dejar hasta el pueblo y luego debe caminar a pie unos minutos para recoger los productos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos puertas para su casa; debido a que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa y le hacen falta las puertas y ventanas; pero con el préstamo solo comprara las dos puertas. Así, ella y su esposo podrán salir más confiados, porque su casa estará más segura y no andarán pensando que la casa esta sin puertas y que alguien se pueda meter.  Su deseo, es que su hija estudie para que pueda defenderse muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria is 23 years old and has a son.  She learned to do farm labor from her father, but currently sells perfumes via catalog.  A friend taught her.  She learned this trade so that she could help her husband with the household expenses.  The products are delivered in town and she has to walk a few minutes to pick them up.

She will use the money from the loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo to buy two doors for her home which she managed to build with great effort; but it still needs doors and windows.  In this way she and her husband can be more confident because the home will be more secure and they will not have to worry about someone getting in because there are no doors.  She wants her son to study so that she can be successful on her own.

loans.use: to buy doors for her home.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina continúa  con el trabajo de profesora en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco y con la confección de chompas de lana. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la enseñan y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana. 

Rina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rina keeps on working as a teacher in a Cusco school, as well as engaging in fashioning woolen sweaters. She has been engaged in teaching for a few years already, and things are going very well thanks to the dedication she works with. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy wool.

Rina is grateful for the support she is receiving and at the same time she commits to meticulously complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia Maria se dedica al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo y verduras.

La socia solicita esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria runs a restaurant, preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She works form 8 am to 5 pm, she has been engaging in this activity for 7 years and things are going very well. She dreams of enlarging her restaurant, and she is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Bertha Urbelinda

texts.es:
